built with pdoc

pricegenerator.PriceGenerator

PriceGenerator is the platform for generating prices similar to real stock prices, but you can control the statistics of their distribution. Generates chain of candlesticks with predefined statistical parameters, return Pandas DataFrame or saving as .CSV-file with OHLCV-candlestick in every string. Use PriceGenerator to generate synthetic data to test your trading strategy.

In additional you can view some statistical and probability parameters of generated or loaded prices.

Sample example:

Use PriceGenerator to generate synthetic data to test your trading strategy.

 211class PriceGenerator:
 212    """
 213    This class implements methods to generation of prices statistically similar to real ones.
 214
 215    **Model generated: OHLCV-candlesticks (open, high, low, close, volume).**
 216    """
 217
 218    def __init__(self):
 219        """Main class init."""
 220        self.prices = None
 221        """Generated or loaded prices will be available in this Pandas DataFrame variable."""
 222
 223        self.csvHeaders = ["date", "time", "open", "high", "low", "close", "volume"]
 224        """Headers in .CSV-file. Default: `["date", "time", "open", "high", "low", "close", "volume"]`."""
 225
 226        self.dfHeaders = ["datetime", "open", "high", "low", "close", "volume"]
 227        """Headers in Pandas DataFrame. Default: `["datetime", "open", "high", "low", "close", "volume"]`."""
 228
 229        self.sep = ","
 230        """Separator in csv - file. Default: `,`"""
 231
 232        self.j2template = GOOGLE_TEMPLATE_J2
 233        """Full path to custom jinja2 html-template file (e.g. `google_template_example.j2`) or just set here a long multi-string variable. Default: `GOOGLE_TEMPLATE_J2` is a multi-string variable with internal template."""
 234
 235        self.j2model = None
 236        """Dictionary of variables for jinja2 template. If `None` then used default variables for internal `GOOGLE_TEMPLATE_J2`"""
 237
 238        self._precision = 2
 239        """Signs after comma. Default: `2`."""
 240
 241        self._deg10prec = 100
 242        """Constant 10^precision is used by some formulas. Not recommended to change it. Default: `100` (`10 ** precision`)."""
 243
 244        self.ticker = "TEST"
 245        """Some fake ticker name. Default: `Test`."""
 246
 247        self.timeframe = timedelta(hours=1)
 248        """Time delta between two neighbour candles. Default: `timedelta(hours=1)`."""
 249
 250        self.timeStart = datetime.now(tzlocal()).replace(microsecond=0, second=0, minute=0)
 251        """First date and time for candles chain."""
 252
 253        self.horizon = None
 254        """Candlesticks count in generated or loaded chain of prices, must be >= 5. Default: `None` (means auto-detect length of chain if loaded from file)."""
 255
 256        self.trendSplit = ""
 257        r"""Set different trends, e.g. `trendSplit="/\-"` means that generated candles has uptrend at first part, next downtrend and then no trend. Used only together with `splitCount` variable. Also, you can use words: `up`, `down`, `no` or chars: `u`, `d`, `n` with the hyphen symbol as separator, e.g. `trendSplit=up-down-no-up`, `trendSplit=u-d-n-u` etc. Default: `""`, empty string mean that will be used random trend directions."""
 258
 259        self.splitCount = []
 260        """Set candles count in different trends, e.g. `splitCount=[5, 10, 15]` means that generated candles has 3 trends with 5, 10 and 15 candles in chain, with sum must be equal to horizon. Used only together with `trendSplit` variable. Default: `[]`, empty list mean that will be used random candles count in trends."""
 261
 262        self.maxClose = random.uniform(70, 90)
 263        """Maximum of close prices must be >= `minClose`. Default: random in interval `(70, 90)`."""
 264
 265        self.minClose = random.uniform(60, 70)
 266        """Minimum of close prices must be <= `maxClose`. Default: random in interval `(60, 70)`."""
 267
 268        self.initClose = None
 269        """First candle close price value. If `None` then used random number in interval between `minClose` and `maxClose`. Default: `None`."""
 270
 271        self.maxOutlier = None
 272        """Maximum size of outliers. If `None` then used value `(maxClose - minClose) / 10`. Default: `None`."""
 273
 274        self.maxCandleBody = None
 275        """Maximum of candle body sizes: `abs(open - close)`. If `None` then used value `maxOutlier * 90%`. Default: `None`."""
 276
 277        self._maxVolume = random.randint(0, 100000)
 278        """Maximum of generated trade volumes. Default: random in interval `(0, 100000)`."""
 279
 280        self._upCandlesProb = 0.5
 281        """Probability that next candle is up. Default: `0.5` (means 50% of probability)."""
 282
 283        self._outliersProb = 0.03
 284        """Outlier probability (price tails). Default: `0.03` (means 3% of probability)."""
 285
 286        self._trendDeviation = 0.005
 287        """Relative deviation for trend detection. "NO trend" if `(1st_close - last_close) / 1st_close <= self.trendDeviation`. Default: `0.005` (means 0.5% of price deviation)."""
 288
 289        self._chartTitle = ""
 290        """Chart title. It will be auto-generated when loading or creating chain of candlesticks."""
 291
 292        self._zigZagDeviation = 0.03
 293        """Relative deviation to detection next points used by Zig-Zag indicator. Default: `0.03` (means 3% of price deviation)."""
 294
 295        self._stat = {
 296            "candles": 0,  # generated candlesticks count
 297            "precision": 2,  # generated candlesticks count
 298            "closeFirst": 0.,  # first close price
 299            "closeLast": 0.,  # last close price
 300            "closeMax": 0.,  # max close price
 301            "closeMix": 0.,  # min close price
 302            "diapason": 0.,  # diapason = closeMax - closeMin
 303            "trend": "NO trend",  # "UP trend" or "DOWN trend" with uses self.trendDeviation
 304            "trendDev": 0.005,
 305            "upCount": 0,  # count of up candles
 306            "downCount": 0,  # count of down candles
 307            "upCountChainMax": 0,  # max chain count of up candles
 308            "downCountChainMax": 0,  # max chain count of down candles
 309            "deltas": {
 310                "max": 0.,  # delta max = max(close_prices)
 311                "min": 0.,  # delta min = min(close_prices)
 312                "stDev": 0.,  # standard deviation
 313                "q99": 0.,  # 99 percentile
 314                "q95": 0.,  # 95 percentile
 315                "q80": 0.,  # 80 percentile
 316                "q50": 0.,  # 50 percentile
 317            },
 318            "cumSumVolumes": 0  # cumulative sum of volumes
 319        }
 320        """Some statistics available after candles loaded or generated."""
 321
 322    @property
 323    def upCandlesProb(self):
 324        """Probability that next candle is up. Default: `0.5` (means 50% of probability)."""
 325        return self._upCandlesProb
 326
 327    @upCandlesProb.setter
 328    def upCandlesProb(self, value):
 329        if value is None or value < 0:
 330            self._upCandlesProb = 0
 331
 332        elif value > 1:
 333            self._upCandlesProb = 1
 334
 335        else:
 336            self._upCandlesProb = value
 337
 338    @property
 339    def outliersProb(self):
 340        """Outlier probability (price tails). Default: `0.03` (means 3% of probability)."""
 341        return self._outliersProb
 342
 343    @outliersProb.setter
 344    def outliersProb(self, value):
 345        if value is None or value < 0:
 346            self._outliersProb = 0
 347
 348        elif value > 1:
 349            self._outliersProb = 1
 350
 351        else:
 352            self._outliersProb = value
 353
 354    @property
 355    def trendDeviation(self):
 356        """Relative deviation for trend detection. "NO trend" if `(1st_close - last_close) / 1st_close <= self.trendDeviation`. Default: `0.005` (means 0.5% of price deviation)."""
 357        return self._trendDeviation
 358
 359    @trendDeviation.setter
 360    def trendDeviation(self, value):
 361        if value is None or value < 0:
 362            self._trendDeviation = 0
 363
 364        elif value > 1:
 365            self._trendDeviation = 1
 366
 367        else:
 368            self._trendDeviation = value
 369
 370    @property
 371    def maxVolume(self):
 372        """Maximum of generated trade volumes. Default: random in interval `(0, 100000)`."""
 373        return self._maxVolume
 374
 375    @maxVolume.setter
 376    def maxVolume(self, value):
 377        if value is None or value < 0:
 378            self._maxVolume = 0
 379
 380        else:
 381            self._maxVolume = value
 382
 383    @property
 384    def stat(self) -> dict:
 385        """Some statistics available after candles loaded or generated."""
 386        return self._stat
 387
 388    @property
 389    def precision(self):
 390        """Signs after comma."""
 391        return self._precision
 392
 393    @precision.setter
 394    def precision(self, value):
 395        self._precision = 2  # default
 396        self._deg10prec = 100  # default
 397
 398        if isinstance(value, int):
 399            if value >= 0:
 400                self._precision = value
 401                self._deg10prec = 10 ** value  # 10^precision
 402
 403    @property
 404    def zigZagDeviation(self):
 405        """Relative deviation to detection next points used by Zig-Zag indicator. Default: 0.03 (means 3% of price deviation)."""
 406        return self._zigZagDeviation
 407
 408    @zigZagDeviation.setter
 409    def zigZagDeviation(self, value):
 410        if value is None or value < 0:
 411            self._zigZagDeviation = 0.03  # by default
 412
 413        elif value > 1:
 414            self._zigZagDeviation = 1
 415
 416        else:
 417            self._zigZagDeviation = value
 418
 419    @staticmethod
 420    def FormattedDelta(tDelta: timedelta, fmt: str) -> str:
 421        """
 422        Pretty format for timedelta objects.
 423
 424        Example: `FormattedDelta(timedelta(days=2, hours=3, minutes=15, seconds=35), "{days} days {hours}:{minutes}:{seconds}") -> "2 days 3:15:35"`.
 425
 426        :return: timedelta object formatted as a string.
 427        """
 428        d = {"days": tDelta.days}
 429        d["hours"], rem = divmod(tDelta.seconds, 3600)
 430        d["minutes"], d["seconds"] = divmod(rem, 60)
 431
 432        return fmt.format(**d)
 433
 434    def DetectPrecision(self, examples: Union[np.ndarray, pd.Series, list]) -> int:
 435        """
 436        Auto-detect precision from example values. E.g. `0.123 -> 3`, `0.12345 -> 5` and so on.
 437        This method change `precision` variable after detect precision.
 438
 439        See also about statistics.mode: https://docs.python.org/3.9/library/statistics.html#statistics.mode
 440        Changed in Python version >= 3.8: Now mode() method handles multimodal datasets by returning the first mode encountered.
 441        Previously, it raised StatisticsError when more than one mode was found.
 442
 443        :param examples: chain with examples of float values.
 444        """
 445        uLogger.debug("Detecting precision of data values...")
 446        precision = 0
 447        try:
 448            precision = mode(list(map(lambda x: len(str(x).split('.')[-1]) if len(str(x).split('.')) > 1 else 0, examples))) if self.precision >= 0 else 0
 449
 450        except StatisticsError as e:
 451            uLogger.debug("Statistic mode() method return an error! Precision is set to 2 (default). StatisticsError: '{}'".format(e))
 452            precision = 2
 453
 454        finally:
 455            uLogger.debug("Auto-detected precision: {}".format(precision))
 456
 457        self.precision = precision
 458
 459        return precision
 460
 461    def DetectTimeframe(self) -> timedelta:
 462        """
 463        Auto-detect time delta between last two neighbour candles.
 464
 465        :return: timedelta object, also saved to `timeframe`.
 466        """
 467        self.timeframe = min(
 468            self.prices.iloc[-1].datetime - self.prices.iloc[-2].datetime,
 469            self.prices.iloc[-2].datetime - self.prices.iloc[-3].datetime
 470        )
 471        uLogger.debug("Auto-detected timeframe: {}".format(self.timeframe))
 472
 473        return self.timeframe
 474
 475    def LoadFromFile(self, fileName: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
 476        """
 477        Create Pandas OHLCV-model from CSV-file.
 478        Default columns in CSV-file are `["date", "time", "open", "high", "low", "close", "volume"]`.
 479
 480        :param fileName: path to CSV-file with OHLCV columns.
 481        :return: Pandas DataFrame.
 482        """
 483        uLogger.info("Loading, parse and preparing input data from [{}]...".format(os.path.abspath(fileName)))
 484
 485        self.prices = pd.read_csv(fileName, names=self.csvHeaders, engine="python", sep=self.sep, parse_dates={"datetime": ["date", "time"]})
 486        if self.horizon is None or self.horizon < 1 or self.horizon > len(self.prices):
 487            self.horizon = len(self.prices)  # use loaded file "as is" with all candles
 488
 489        else:
 490            self.prices = self.prices.tail(self.horizon)  # remove old candles, leave only the "tail" ...
 491            self.prices.index = range(self.horizon)  # ... and reindex
 492
 493        self.ticker = os.path.basename(fileName)
 494
 495        self.DetectTimeframe()  # auto-detect time delta between last two neighbour candles
 496
 497        uLogger.info("It was read {} rows".format(self.horizon))
 498        uLogger.info("Showing last 5 rows as Pandas DataFrame:")
 499        for line in pd.DataFrame.to_string(self.prices[self.dfHeaders][-5:], max_cols=20).split("\n"):
 500            uLogger.info(line)
 501
 502        return self.prices
 503
 504    def SaveToFile(self, fileName: str) -> None:
 505        """
 506        Save Pandas OHLCV model to CSV-file.
 507
 508        :param fileName: path to CSV-file.
 509        """
 510        if self.prices is not None and not self.prices.empty:
 511            uLogger.info("Saving [{}] rows of Pandas DataFrame with columns: {}...".format(len(self.prices), self.csvHeaders))
 512            uLogger.debug("Delimeter: {}".format(self.sep))
 513            dataReplacedDateTime = self.prices.copy(deep=True)
 514            dataReplacedDateTime["date"] = [d.date() for d in dataReplacedDateTime["datetime"]]
 515            dataReplacedDateTime["time"] = [d.time() for d in dataReplacedDateTime["datetime"]]
 516            del dataReplacedDateTime["datetime"]
 517            dataReplacedDateTime = dataReplacedDateTime[self.csvHeaders]
 518            dataReplacedDateTime.to_csv(fileName, sep=self.sep, index=False, header=False)
 519            uLogger.info("Pandas DataFrame saved to .CSV-file [{}]".format(os.path.abspath(fileName)))
 520
 521        else:
 522            raise Exception("Empty price data! Generate or load prices before saving!")
 523
 524    @staticmethod
 525    def GetTrend(firstClose: float, lastClose: float, trendDeviation: float = 0.005) -> str:
 526        """
 527        Get string with trend: `"UP trend"`, `"DOWN trend"` or `"NO trend"`.
 528
 529        :param firstClose: close of first candle.
 530        :param lastClose: close of last candle.
 531        :param trendDeviation: relative deviation for trend detection, 0.005 mean 0.5% by default.
 532        :return: string with trend direction `"NO trend"`, `"UP trend"` or `"DOWN trend"`.
 533        """
 534        if abs(firstClose - lastClose) / firstClose <= trendDeviation:
 535            trend = "NO trend"
 536
 537        else:
 538            trend = "UP trend" if firstClose <= lastClose else "DOWN trend"
 539
 540        return trend
 541
 542    @staticmethod
 543    def ZigZagFilter(datetimes: pd.Series, values: Union[pd.Series, list], deviation: float) -> dict:
 544        """
 545        This method filter input data as Zig-Zag indicator: when input value of candlestick price (e.g. close price)
 546        is difference with next values with define percent then this point is a point of Zig-Zag indicator.
 547
 548        :param datetimes: input Pandas Series with datetime values.
 549        :param values: input Pandas Series or list, e.g. list of closes values of candlesticks.
 550        :param deviation: float number in `[0, 1]` interval is a relative difference between `i` and `i + 1` values to set as Zig-Zag point.
 551        :return: dict with Pandas Series filtered data `{"datetimes": filtered_datetimes, "filtered": filtered_values}`.
 552        """
 553        filteredPoints = [True]
 554        prev = values[0]
 555        for i in range(1, len(values)):
 556            difference = abs(values[i] - prev) / prev
 557            if difference >= deviation:
 558                filteredPoints.append(True)
 559                prev = values[i]
 560
 561            else:
 562                filteredPoints.append(False)
 563
 564        return {"datetimes": datetimes[filteredPoints], "filtered": values[filteredPoints]}
 565
 566    def GetStatistics(self) -> list[str]:
 567        """
 568        Calculates statistics of candles chain.
 569
 570        :return: list with text in Markdown format with statistics.
 571        """
 572        uLogger.debug("Calculating column with deltas between high and low values...")
 573        self.prices["delta"] = self.prices.high.values - self.prices.low.values
 574
 575        uLogger.debug("Calculating column with average values...")
 576        self.prices["avg"] = round((self.prices.high + self.prices.low) / 2, self._precision)
 577
 578        uLogger.debug("Calculating some technical analysis indicators...")
 579        self.prices["sma5"] = ta.sma(close=self.prices.close, length=5, offset=None)
 580        self.prices["sma20"] = ta.sma(close=self.prices.close, length=20, offset=None)
 581        self.prices["sma50"] = ta.sma(close=self.prices.close, length=50, offset=None)
 582        self.prices["sma200"] = ta.sma(close=self.prices.close, length=200, offset=None)
 583        self.prices["hma5"] = ta.hma(close=self.prices.close, length=5, offset=None)
 584        self.prices["hma20"] = ta.hma(close=self.prices.close, length=20, offset=None)
 585        self.prices["vwma5"] = ta.vwma(close=self.prices.close, volume=self.prices.volume, length=5, offset=None)
 586        self.prices["vwma20"] = ta.vwma(close=self.prices.close, volume=self.prices.volume, length=20, offset=None)
 587        bbands = ta.bbands(close=self.prices.close, length=None, std=None, mamode=None, offset=None)
 588        bbands.columns = ["lower", "mid", "upper", "bandwidth", "percent"]
 589        psar = ta.psar(high=self.prices.high, low=self.prices.low, close=self.prices.close, af=0.02, max_af=0.2, offset=None)
 590        psar.columns = ["long", "short", "af", "reversal"]
 591        self.prices["hma13"] = ta.hma(close=self.prices.close, length=13, offset=8)  # alligator Jaw
 592        self.prices["hma8"] = ta.hma(close=self.prices.close, length=8, offset=5)  # alligator Teeth
 593        self.prices["hma5"] = ta.hma(close=self.prices.close, length=5, offset=3)  # alligator Lips
 594        zigzag = self.ZigZagFilter(datetimes=self.prices.datetime, values=self.prices.close, deviation=self.zigZagDeviation)  # ZigZag indicator
 595
 596        self.DetectPrecision(self.prices.close.values)  # auto-detect precision
 597
 598        self._chartTitle = "Instrument: {}, timeframe: {}, horizon length: {} (from {} to {})".format(
 599            self.ticker,
 600            self.FormattedDelta(
 601                self.timeframe, "{days} days {hours}h {minutes}m {seconds}s"
 602            ) if self.timeframe >= timedelta(days=1) else self.FormattedDelta(
 603                self.timeframe, "{hours}h {minutes}m {seconds}s"
 604            ),
 605            self.horizon,
 606            pd.to_datetime(self.prices.datetime.values[0]).strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"),
 607            pd.to_datetime(self.prices.datetime.values[-1]).strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"),
 608        )
 609
 610        self._stat["candles"] = len(self.prices)
 611        self._stat["precision"] = self.precision
 612        self._stat["closeFirst"] = self.prices.close.values[0]
 613        self._stat["closeLast"] = self.prices.close.values[-1]
 614        self._stat["closeMax"] = pd.DataFrame.max(self.prices.close)
 615        self._stat["closeMin"] = pd.DataFrame.min(self.prices.close)
 616        self._stat["diapason"] = self._stat["closeMax"] - self._stat["closeMin"]
 617        self._stat["trend"] = self.GetTrend(firstClose=self._stat["closeFirst"], lastClose=self._stat["closeLast"], trendDeviation=self.trendDeviation)
 618
 619        self.prices["up"] = self.prices.close >= self.prices.open  # True mean that is up candle, and False mean down
 620        upList = list(self.prices.up)
 621        upChainsLengths = [len(list(chain)) for value, chain in groupby(upList) if value is True]
 622        downChainsLengths = [len(list(chain)) for value, chain in groupby(upList) if value is False]
 623
 624        self._stat["trendDev"] = self.trendDeviation
 625        self._stat["upCount"] = len(self.prices.up[self.prices.up == True])
 626        self._stat["downCount"] = len(self.prices.up[self.prices.up == False])
 627        self._stat["upCountChainMax"] = max(upChainsLengths) if upChainsLengths else 1
 628        self._stat["downCountChainMax"] = max(downChainsLengths) if downChainsLengths else 1
 629        self._stat["deltas"]["max"] = pd.DataFrame.max(self.prices.delta)
 630        self._stat["deltas"]["min"] = pd.DataFrame.min(self.prices.delta)
 631        self._stat["deltas"]["stDev"] = round(pstdev(self.prices.delta), self._precision)
 632        self._stat["deltas"]["q99"] = round(max(pd.DataFrame(self.prices.delta).quantile(q=0.99, interpolation='linear')), self._precision)
 633        self._stat["deltas"]["q95"] = round(max(pd.DataFrame(self.prices.delta).quantile(q=0.95, interpolation='linear')), self._precision)
 634        self._stat["deltas"]["q80"] = round(max(pd.DataFrame(self.prices.delta).quantile(q=0.80, interpolation='linear')), self._precision)
 635        self._stat["deltas"]["q50"] = round(max(pd.DataFrame(self.prices.delta).quantile(q=0.50, interpolation='linear')), self._precision)
 636        self._stat["cumSumVolumes"] = self.prices.volume.sum()
 637
 638        self._stat["sma5"] = self.prices["sma5"]
 639        self._stat["sma20"] = self.prices["sma20"]
 640        self._stat["sma50"] = self.prices["sma50"]
 641        self._stat["sma200"] = self.prices["sma200"]
 642        self._stat["hma5"] = self.prices["hma5"]
 643        self._stat["hma20"] = self.prices["hma20"]
 644        self._stat["vwma5"] = self.prices["vwma5"]
 645        self._stat["vwma20"] = self.prices["vwma20"]
 646        self._stat["bbands"] = bbands
 647        self._stat["psar"] = psar
 648        self._stat["hma13"] = self.prices["hma13"]
 649        self._stat["hma8"] = self.prices["hma8"]
 650        self._stat["hma5"] = self.prices["hma5"]
 651        self._stat["zigzag3"] = zigzag
 652
 653        summary = [
 654            "# Summary",
 655            "- Candles count: {}".format(self.stat["candles"]),
 656            "- Timeframe: {}".format(self.timeframe),
 657            "- Precision (signs after comma): {}".format(self.stat["precision"]),
 658            "- Close, first: {}".format(round(self.stat["closeFirst"], self.precision)),
 659            "- Close, last: {}".format(round(self.stat["closeLast"], self.precision)),
 660            "- Close, max: {}".format(round(self.stat["closeMax"], self.precision)),
 661            "- Close, min: {}".format(round(self.stat["closeMin"], self.precision)),
 662            "- Diapason, |close_max - close_min|: {}".format(round(self.stat["diapason"], self.precision)),
 663            "- Trend, |close_1st - close_last|: {}".format(self.stat["trend"]),
 664            "",
 665            "# Statistics",
 666            "- Up candles count: {} ({}%)".format(self.stat["upCount"], round(100 * self.stat["upCount"] / self.stat["candles"], self.precision)),
 667            "- Down candles count: {} ({}%)".format(self.stat["downCount"], round(100 * self.stat["downCount"] / self.stat["candles"], self.precision)),
 668            "- Max of up / down candle chains: {} / {}".format(self.stat["upCountChainMax"], self.stat["downCountChainMax"]),
 669            "- Max delta, |high - low|: {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["max"], self.precision)),
 670            "- Min delta, |high - low|: {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["min"], self.precision)),
 671            "- Delta's std. dev.: {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["stDev"], self.precision)),
 672            "  - 99 percentile:  {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["q99"], self.precision)),
 673            "  - 95 percentile:  {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["q95"], self.precision)),
 674            "  - 80 percentile:  {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["q80"], self.precision)),
 675            "- Cumulative sum of volumes: {}".format(self.stat["cumSumVolumes"]),
 676        ]
 677
 678        uLogger.info("Some statistics:\n{}".format("\n".join(summary)))
 679
 680        return summary
 681
 682    def _GenNextCandle(self, lastClose) -> dict:
 683        """
 684        Generator for creating 1 next candle based on global probability parameters.
 685
 686        :param lastClose: value of last close price.
 687        :return: one OHLCV-candle as dict.
 688        """
 689        candle = {
 690            "open": lastClose,
 691            "high": 0,
 692            "low": 0,
 693            "close": 0,
 694            "volume": random.randint(a=0, b=self.maxVolume)
 695        }
 696
 697        if random.random() <= self.upCandlesProb:
 698            maxBody = min(self.maxClose, candle["open"] + self.maxCandleBody)
 699            candle["close"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["open"], b=maxBody), self.precision)  # up candle
 700
 701            if random.random() <= self.outliersProb:
 702                candle["high"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["close"], b=candle["close"] + self.maxOutlier), self.precision)  # with outlier price "tails"
 703                candle["low"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["open"] - self.maxOutlier, b=candle["open"]), self.precision)
 704
 705            else:
 706                halfBody = (candle["close"] - candle["open"]) / 2
 707                candle["high"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["close"], b=candle["close"] + halfBody), self.precision)  # without outlier price "tails"
 708                candle["low"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["open"] - halfBody, b=candle["open"]), self.precision)
 709
 710        else:
 711            minBody = max(self.minClose, candle["open"] - self.maxCandleBody)
 712            candle["close"] = round(random.uniform(a=minBody, b=candle["open"]), self.precision)  # down candle
 713
 714            if random.random() <= self.outliersProb:
 715                candle["high"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["open"], b=candle["open"] + self.maxOutlier), self.precision)  # with outlier price "tails"
 716                candle["low"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["close"] - self.maxOutlier, b=candle["close"]), self.precision)
 717
 718            else:
 719                halfBody = (candle["open"] - candle["close"]) / 2
 720                candle["high"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["open"], b=candle["open"] + halfBody), self.precision)  # without outlier price "tails"
 721                candle["low"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["close"] - halfBody, b=candle["close"]), self.precision)
 722
 723        return candle
 724
 725    def Generate(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 726        """
 727        Main method to generating prices.
 728
 729        :return Pandas DataFrame object with OHLCV-candlestick in every row and also saving it to the `prices`.
 730        """
 731        if self.horizon is None or self.horizon < 5:
 732            self.horizon = 5
 733            uLogger.debug("Horizon length less than 5! It is set to 5 by default.")
 734
 735        if self.trendSplit is not None and self.splitCount is not None:
 736            # Detecting input trend:
 737            self.trendSplit = self.trendSplit.lower()
 738            if "/" in self.trendSplit or "\\" in self.trendSplit:
 739                uLogger.debug("Detected old-style string for split trend: {}".format(self.trendSplit))
 740
 741                self.trendSplit = self.trendSplit.replace("-", "-no-").replace("/", "-up-").replace("\\", "-down-").replace("--", "-").lstrip("-").rstrip("-")
 742
 743            else:
 744                uLogger.debug("Detected new-style string for split trend: {}".format(self.trendSplit))
 745
 746                self.trendSplit = "-{}-".format(self.trendSplit)
 747                self.trendSplit = self.trendSplit.replace("-u-", "-up-").replace("-d-", "-down-").replace("-n-", "-no-").lstrip("-").rstrip("-")
 748
 749            uLogger.debug("New style string for trend split is set: {}".format(self.trendSplit))
 750
 751            trends = self.trendSplit.split("-")
 752
 753            uLogger.debug("Trends list: {}".format(trends))
 754
 755            if len(trends) > self.horizon:
 756                trends = trends[0]
 757
 758                uLogger.debug("Trend parts count ({}) must be less than horizon ({})! New trend will be used: {}".format(len(trends), self.horizon, trends[0]))
 759
 760            if sum(self.splitCount) != self.horizon or len(trends) == 1:
 761                self.splitCount = [self.horizon]
 762
 763                uLogger.debug("Only one trend will be used with length equal to horizon: {}".format(self.splitCount))
 764
 765            if len(self.splitCount) != len(trends):
 766                self.trendSplit = None
 767                self.splitCount = None
 768
 769                uLogger.debug("Random trend direction will be used, because trends count not equal to split count!")
 770
 771        else:
 772            trends = []
 773
 774        # maximum of candle sizes: (high - low), if None then used (maxClose - minClose) / 10
 775        if self.maxOutlier is None:
 776            self.maxOutlier = (self.maxClose - self.minClose) / 10
 777
 778        # maximum of candle body sizes: abs(open - close), if None then used maxOutlier * 90%
 779        if self.maxCandleBody is None:
 780            self.maxCandleBody = 0.9 * self.maxOutlier
 781
 782        # initClose is the last close price (left on chart or "before" 1st generated candle), 1st candle["open"] = initClose
 783        if self.initClose is None:
 784            self.initClose = round(random.uniform(a=self.minClose, b=self.maxClose), self.precision)
 785
 786        uLogger.info("Generating prices...")
 787        uLogger.debug("- Ticker name: {}".format(self.ticker))
 788        uLogger.debug("- Precision: {}".format(self.precision))
 789        uLogger.debug("- Interval or timeframe (time delta between two neighbour candles): {}".format(self.timeframe))
 790        uLogger.debug("- Horizon length (candlesticks count): {}".format(self.horizon))
 791        if self.trendSplit is not None and self.trendSplit and self.splitCount is not None and self.splitCount:
 792            uLogger.debug("- Trend type: {}".format(self.trendSplit))
 793            uLogger.debug("- Candlesticks count in every mini-trend: {}".format(self.splitCount))
 794
 795        uLogger.debug("- Start time: {}".format(self.timeStart.strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")))
 796        uLogger.debug("  |-> end time: {}".format((self.timeStart + self.horizon * self.timeframe).strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")))
 797        uLogger.debug("- Maximum of close prices: {}".format(round(self.maxClose, self.precision)))
 798        uLogger.debug("- Minimum of close prices: {}".format(round(self.minClose, self.precision)))
 799        uLogger.debug("- Maximum of candle body sizes: {}".format(round(self.maxCandleBody, self.precision)))
 800        uLogger.debug("- Maximum of candle tails outlier sizes: {}".format(round(self.maxOutlier, self.precision)))
 801        uLogger.debug("- Init close (1st open price in chain): {}".format(round(self.initClose, self.precision)))
 802        uLogger.debug("- Maximum of volume of one candle: {}".format(self.maxVolume))
 803        uLogger.debug("- Probability that next candle is up: {}%".format(self.upCandlesProb * 100))
 804        uLogger.debug("- Statistical outliers probability: {}%".format(self.outliersProb * 100))
 805
 806        # -- Preparing candles chain:
 807        if self.trendSplit is not None and self.trendSplit and self.splitCount is not None and self.splitCount:
 808            userProb = self.upCandlesProb
 809            userHorizon = self.horizon
 810            userInitC = self.initClose
 811            candles = []
 812
 813            for trendNum in range(len(trends)):
 814                self.horizon = self.splitCount[trendNum]
 815                self.initClose = candles[-1]["close"] if trendNum > 0 else self.initClose
 816
 817                # change probability of candles direction in next trend:
 818                if trends[trendNum] == "up":
 819                    self.upCandlesProb = 0.51 if userProb <= 0.5 else userProb
 820
 821                elif trends[trendNum] == "down":
 822                    self.upCandlesProb = 0.49 if userProb >= 0.5 else userProb
 823
 824                elif trends[trendNum] == "no":
 825                    self.upCandlesProb = 0.5
 826
 827                else:
 828                    uLogger.error("Unknown direction used: {}".format(trends[trendNum]))
 829
 830                    raise Exception("Unknown direction")
 831
 832                firstCandle = self._GenNextCandle(round(self.initClose, self.precision))  # first candle in next trend
 833                candles.append(firstCandle)
 834
 835                for _ in range(1, self.horizon):
 836                    candles.append(self._GenNextCandle(candles[-1]["close"]))
 837
 838                highDelta = abs(candles[-1]["high"] - max(candles[-1]["open"], candles[-1]["close"]))  # save higher shadow
 839                lowDelta = abs(min(candles[-1]["open"], candles[-1]["close"]) - candles[-1]["low"])  # save lower shadow
 840
 841                # -- Change last candle in every trend:
 842                if trends[trendNum] == "up":
 843                    if firstCandle["close"] >= candles[-1]["close"]:
 844                        candles[-1]["close"] = round(random.uniform(a=firstCandle["close"], b=self.maxClose), self.precision)
 845
 846                elif trends[trendNum] == "down":
 847                    if firstCandle["close"] < candles[-1]["close"]:
 848                        candles[-1]["close"] = round(random.uniform(a=self.minClose, b=firstCandle["close"]), self.precision)
 849
 850                else:  # if NO trend:
 851                    if abs(firstCandle["close"] - candles[-1]["close"]) / firstCandle["close"] > self.trendDeviation:
 852                        candles[-1]["close"] = round(
 853                            random.uniform(
 854                                a=firstCandle["close"] - firstCandle["close"] * self.trendDeviation / 2,
 855                                b=firstCandle["close"] + firstCandle["close"] * self.trendDeviation / 2,
 856                            ),
 857                            self.precision,
 858                        )
 859
 860                candles[-1]["high"] = max(candles[-1]["open"], candles[-1]["close"]) + highDelta  # fixing higher shadow
 861                candles[-1]["low"] = min(candles[-1]["open"], candles[-1]["close"]) - lowDelta  # fixing lower shadow
 862
 863            self.upCandlesProb = userProb
 864            self.horizon = userHorizon
 865            self.initClose = userInitC
 866
 867        else:
 868            candles = [self._GenNextCandle(round(self.initClose, self.precision))]  # first candle in chain
 869            for _ in range(1, self.horizon):
 870                candles.append(self._GenNextCandle(candles[-1]["close"]))
 871
 872        # prepare Dataframe from generated prices:
 873        indx = pd.date_range(
 874            start=self.timeStart,
 875            end=self.timeStart + (self.horizon - 1) * self.timeframe,
 876            freq=self.timeframe,
 877            tz=tzlocal(),
 878        )
 879        self.prices = pd.DataFrame(data=candles, columns=self.dfHeaders)
 880        self.prices.datetime = indx
 881
 882        uLogger.info("Showing last 5 rows of Pandas generated dataframe object:")
 883        for line in pd.DataFrame.to_string(self.prices[self.dfHeaders][-5:], max_cols=20).split("\n"):
 884            uLogger.info(line)
 885
 886        return self.prices
 887
 888    def RenderBokeh(
 889            self, fileName: Optional[str] = "index.html", viewInBrowser: bool = False,
 890            darkTheme: bool = False, markers: Optional[pd.DataFrame] = None, lines: Optional[list[pd.DataFrame]] = None,
 891            title: Optional[str] = None, width: Optional[int] = 1800, height: Optional[int] = 940,
 892            showControlsOnChart: bool = True, showStatOnChart: bool = True, inline: bool = False,
 893    ) -> Optional[gridplot]:
 894        """
 895        Rendering prices from Pandas DataFrame as OHLCV Bokeh chart of candlesticks and save it to HTML-file.
 896        Pandas DataFrame in `prices` variable must contain "datetime", "open", "high", "low", "close" and "volume" columns.
 897
 898        See also: https://docs.bokeh.org/en/latest/docs/gallery/candlestick.html
 899
 900        :param fileName: HTML-file path to save Bokeh chart. `index.html` by default.
 901        :param viewInBrowser: If `True`, then immediately opens HTML chart in browser after rendering. `False` by default.
 902        :param darkTheme: chart theme. `False` by default, mean that will be used light theme, `False` mean dark theme.
 903        :param markers: Pandas DataFrame with additional markers that will be placed on main series. `None` by default.
 904                        Marker is a custom symbol, example: ,  or . Dataframe with markers must contain at least two columns.
 905                        There are `datetime` with date and time and some markers columns (`markersUpper`, `markersCenter` or `markersLower`).
 906                        Length of markers series must be equal to the length of main candles series.
 907        :param lines: list with custom series, where additional chart-lines will place on main series. `None` by default.
 908                      Line data must contain at least two columns. There are `datetime` with date and time and
 909                      `custom_line_name` with y-coordinates. Length of the chart-line dataframes must be equal to the length of main candle series.
 910        :param title: specific chart title. If `None`, then used auto-generated title. `None` by default.
 911        :param width: chart width. If `None`, then used auto-width. 1800 px by default.
 912        :param height: chart height. If `None`, then used auto-height. 940 px by default.
 913        :param showControlsOnChart: enable controls block in legend to hide/show some elements on chart, `True` by default.
 914        :param showStatOnChart: show statistics block on chart, `True` (by default) mean that will be calculating additional
 915                                series, like as Trend and Average Points. And some classical indicators, like as SMA, HMA,
 916                                VWMA, Bollinger Bands, Parabolic Stop and Reverse, Alligator and Zig-Zag indicator.
 917                                Warning! Calculate statistic takes more time. If you want to decrease chart rendering time,
 918                                then set this parameter to `False`.
 919        :param inline: if `True`, then output chart in Jupyter Notebook cell. `False` by default.
 920        :return: bokeh.layouts.gridplot with all layouts objects or None.
 921        """
 922        if self.prices is None or self.prices.empty:
 923            raise Exception("Empty price data! Generate or load prices before show as Bokeh chart!")
 924
 925        else:
 926            uLogger.info("Rendering Pandas DataFrame as Bokeh chart...")
 927
 928            self.DetectTimeframe()  # auto-detect time delta between last two neighbour candles
 929            infoBlock = self.GetStatistics() if showStatOnChart else []  # calculating some indicators
 930
 931            title = self._chartTitle if title is None or not title else title  # chart title
 932            width = 1200 if width is None or width <= 0 else width  # chart summary width
 933            height = 800 if height is None or height <= 0 else height - 90  # chart summary height
 934
 935            uLogger.debug("Preparing Bokeh chart configuration...")
 936            uLogger.debug("Title: {}".format(title))
 937
 938            if inline:
 939                output_notebook(resources=INLINE, verbose=False, hide_banner=True)  # set output to notebook cell
 940
 941            # --- Preparing Main chart:
 942            chart = figure(
 943                title=title,
 944                x_axis_type="datetime",
 945                x_axis_label="Date and time",
 946                y_axis_label="Price",
 947                outline_line_width=3,
 948                outline_line_color="black" if darkTheme else "white",
 949                tools=["pan", "wheel_zoom", "box_zoom", "hover", "reset", "save"],
 950                toolbar_location="above",
 951                active_scroll="wheel_zoom",
 952                min_width=width,
 953                height=height,
 954                sizing_mode="scale_width",
 955                background_fill_color="black" if darkTheme else "white",
 956                min_border_left=0,
 957                min_border_right=0,
 958                min_border_top=0,
 959                min_border_bottom=0,
 960                y_range=Range1d(min(self.prices.low) - 3, max(self.prices.high) + 3),
 961            )
 962            chart.toolbar.logo = None  # remove bokeh logo and link to https://bokeh.org/
 963            chart.xaxis.major_label_orientation = pi / 6
 964            chart.grid.grid_line_dash = [6, 4]
 965            chart.grid.grid_line_alpha = 0.4
 966            chart.grid.minor_grid_line_dash = [6, 4]
 967            chart.grid.minor_grid_line_alpha = 0.4
 968            chart.xgrid.minor_grid_line_dash = [6, 4]
 969            chart.xgrid.minor_grid_line_alpha = 0.3
 970            chart.xgrid.minor_grid_line_color = "white" if darkTheme else "gray"
 971            chart.ygrid.minor_grid_line_dash = [6, 4]
 972            chart.ygrid.minor_grid_line_alpha = 0.3
 973            chart.ygrid.minor_grid_line_color = "white" if darkTheme else "gray"
 974
 975            if showStatOnChart:
 976                summaryItems = [(info, []) for info in infoBlock]
 977                if showControlsOnChart:
 978                    summaryItems += [("", []), ("Click to show/hide on chart:", [])]
 979
 980            else:
 981                summaryItems = [("Click to show/hide on chart:", [])] if showControlsOnChart else [("", [])]
 982
 983            summaryInfo = Legend(
 984                click_policy="hide",
 985                items=summaryItems,
 986                location="top_right",
 987                label_text_font_size="8pt",
 988                margin=3,
 989                padding=2,
 990                spacing=-5,
 991                label_text_font="Lucida Console",
 992            )
 993            chart.add_layout(summaryInfo, "right")
 994
 995            # preparing data for candles:
 996            inc = self.prices.open <= self.prices.close
 997            dec = self.prices.open > self.prices.close
 998            candleWidth = 108000  # as for 5 minutes by default
 999
1000            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(days=31):
1001                candleWidth = 864000000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 25 * 800  # for 43200 minutes
1002
1003            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(days=7):
1004                candleWidth = 216000000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 25 * 200  # for 10080 minutes
1005
1006            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(days=1):
1007                candleWidth = 32400000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 25 * 30  # for 1440 minutes
1008
1009            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(hours=4):
1010                candleWidth = 6480000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 25 * 6  # for 240 minutes
1011
1012            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(hours=1):
1013                candleWidth = 1620000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 25 * 1.5  # for 60 minutes
1014
1015            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(minutes=30):
1016                candleWidth = 648000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 15  # for 30 minutes
1017
1018            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(minutes=15):
1019                candleWidth = 345600  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 8  # for 15 minutes
1020
1021            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(minutes=5):
1022                candleWidth = 108000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 2.5  # for 5 minutes
1023
1024            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(minutes=1):
1025                candleWidth = 21600  # 12 * 60 * 30   # for 1 minute
1026
1027            disabledObjects = []  # bokeh objects to hide by default when page is loaded
1028
1029            # preparing data for hover tooltips:
1030            source = {
1031                "candle": [x + 1 for x in range(-len(self.prices.close), 0, 1)],
1032                "datetime": self.prices.datetime,
1033                "open": self.prices.open,
1034                "high": self.prices.high,
1035                "low": self.prices.low,
1036                "close": self.prices.close,
1037                "volume": self.prices.volume,
1038            }
1039            hoverData = ColumnDataSource(data=source)
1040            hover = chart.select(dict(type=HoverTool))
1041            hover.name = "candle"
1042            hover.tooltips = [
1043                ("Candle", "@candle"),
1044                ("Date", "@datetime{%Y-%m-%d}"),
1045                ("Time", "@datetime{%H:%M:%S}"),
1046                ("Open", "@open{0.0000}"),
1047                ("High", "@high{0.0000}"),
1048                ("Low", "@low{0.0000}"),
1049                ("Close", "@close{0.0000}"),
1050                ("Volume", "@volume"),
1051            ]

1053                "@datetime": "datetime",
1054                "@open": "numeral",
1055                "@high": "numeral",
1056                "@low": "numeral",
1057                "@close": "numeral",
1058            }

1060            hover.line_policy = "nearest"
1061            hover.mode = "vline"
1062
1063            # --- preparing body of candles:
1064            hoverOnCandles = chart.segment(
1065                x0="datetime", y0="high", x1="datetime", y1="low",
1066                color="#20ff00" if darkTheme else "black",
1067                line_alpha=1, name="candle", source=hoverData,
1068            )
1069            hover.renderers = [hoverOnCandles]  # hover on only for candle bodies
1070            chart.vbar(
1071                x=self.prices.datetime[inc], width=candleWidth, bottom=self.prices.open[inc], top=self.prices.close[inc],
1072                fill_color="black" if darkTheme else "white", line_color="#20ff00" if darkTheme else "black",
1073                line_width=1, fill_alpha=1, line_alpha=1,
1074            )
1075            chart.vbar(
1076                x=self.prices.datetime[dec], width=candleWidth, bottom=self.prices.open[dec], top=self.prices.close[dec],
1077                fill_color="white" if darkTheme else "#999999", line_color="#20ff00" if darkTheme else "black",
1078                line_width=1, fill_alpha=1, line_alpha=1,
1079            )
1080
1081            if showStatOnChart:
1082                # Summary section and controls:
1083                legendNameMain = "Max close / Min close / Trend line"
1084                legendNameAvg = "Averages points (highs - deltas/2)"
1085                legendNameSMA = "Simple Moving Averages (SMA: 5, 20)"
1086                legendNameSMAlong = "Long Simple Moving Averages (SMA: 50, 200)"
1087                legendNameHMA = "Hull Moving Averages (HMA: 5, 20)"
1088                legendNameVWMA = "Volume Weighted Moving Averages (VWMA: 5, 20)"
1089                legendNameBBANDS = "Bollinger Bands (BBands)"
1090                legendNamePsar = "Parabolic Stop and Reverse (psar)"
1091                legendNameAlligator = "Alligator (based on HMA: 13, 8, 5)"

1093
1094                # preparing for highest close line:
1095                highestClose = round(max(self.prices.close.values), self._precision)

1098                    line_width=2, line_color="yellow" if darkTheme else "#339933", line_alpha=1,
1099                    legend_label=legendNameMain if showControlsOnChart else "",
1100                )

1102                    self.prices.datetime.values[-1], highestClose + 1 / self._deg10prec,
1103                    text=[str(highestClose)], angle=0, text_color="yellow" if darkTheme else "#339933", text_font_size="9pt",
1104                    legend_label=legendNameMain if showControlsOnChart else "",
1105                )
1106

1108                lowestClose = round(min(self.prices.close.values), self._precision)

1110                    self.prices.datetime, lowestClose,
1111                    line_width=2, line_color="yellow" if darkTheme else "#339933", line_alpha=1,

1233                disabledObjects.append(chart.line(
1234                    self.prices.datetime, self.stat["hma13"],
1235                    line_width=2, line_color="#1a1aff" if darkTheme else "#2100A6", line_alpha=1,
1236                    legend_label=legendNameAlligator if showControlsOnChart else "",
1237                ))

1239                    self.prices.datetime, self.stat["hma8"],
1240                    line_width=2, line_color="#ff1a1a" if darkTheme else "#A6000C", line_alpha=1,
1241                    legend_label=legendNameAlligator if showControlsOnChart else "",
1242                ))
1243                disabledObjects.append(chart.line(
1244                    self.prices.datetime, self.stat["hma5"],
1245                    line_width=2, line_color="#40ff00" if darkTheme else "#17A600", line_alpha=1,
1246                    legend_label=legendNameAlligator if showControlsOnChart else "",
1247                ))
1248
1249                # Zig-Zag indicator with self.zigZagDeviation of difference parameter
1250                disabledObjects.append(chart.line(
1251                    self.stat["zigzag3"]["datetimes"], self.stat["zigzag3"]["filtered"],
1252                    line_width=3, line_color="cyan" if darkTheme else "#333333", line_alpha=1,
1253                    legend_label=legendNameZigZag if showControlsOnChart else "",
1254                ))
1255
1256                for item in disabledObjects:
1257                    item.visible = False
1258
1259            # --- Preparing custom markers:
1260
1261            if markers is not None and isinstance(markers, pd.DataFrame) and not markers.empty and len(markers.axes) >= 2 and "datetime" in markers.columns and ("markersUpper" in markers.columns or "markersCenter" in markers.columns or "markersLower" in markers.columns):
1262                if "markersUpper" in markers.columns:
1263                    chart.text(
1264                        markers.datetime.values, self.prices.high + 0.5,

1266                        angle=0, text_color="lime" if darkTheme else "black", text_font_size="13pt",
1267                        legend_label="Markers: upper ({})".format(len(markers.markersUpper[markers.markersUpper != ""])) if showControlsOnChart else "",
1268                    )
1269
1270                if "markersCenter" in markers.columns:
1271                    if "avg" not in self.prices.columns:
1272                        self.prices["avg"] = round((self.prices.high + self.prices.low) / 2, self._precision)
1273
1274                    chart.text(
1275                        markers.datetime.values, self.prices.avg,
1276                        text_align="center", text_baseline="middle", text=markers.markersCenter.values,
1277                        angle=0, text_color="red" if darkTheme else "black", text_font_size="13pt",
1278                        legend_label="Markers: center ({})".format(len(markers.markersCenter[markers.markersCenter != ""])) if showControlsOnChart else "",
1279                    )
1280
1281                if "markersLower" in markers.columns:
1282                    chart.text(
1283                        markers.datetime.values, self.prices.low - 0.5,
1284                        text_align="center", text_baseline="top", text=markers.markersLower.values,
1285                        angle=0, text_color="lime" if darkTheme else "black", text_font_size="13pt",
1286                        legend_label="Markers: lower ({})".format(len(markers.markersLower[markers.markersLower != ""])) if showControlsOnChart else "",
1287                    )
1288
1289            else:
1290                uLogger.debug("Marker data must be the Pandas DataFrame object! Or `None` (by default). Marker is a custom symbol, example: ,  or . Dataframe with markers must contain at least two columns. There are `datetime` with date and time and some markers columns (`markersUpper`, `markersCenter` or `markersLower`). Length of markers series must be equal to the length of main candles series.")
1291
1292            if not (showControlsOnChart or showStatOnChart):
1293                summaryInfo.visible = False
1294
1295            # --- Preparing custom lines:
1296
1297            if lines is not None and isinstance(lines, list) and lines:
1298                for line in lines:
1299                    if isinstance(line, pd.DataFrame) and len(line.axes) >= 2 and "datetime" in line.columns:
1300                        chart.line(
1301                            line.datetime, line[line.columns[1]],
1302                            line_width=3, line_color="red" if darkTheme else "#666666", line_alpha=1,
1303                            legend_label="Line: " + line.columns[1] if showControlsOnChart else "",
1304                        )
1305
1306                    else:
1307                        uLogger.debug("Every custom line must be the Pandas DataFrame object! Line data must contain at least two columns: `datetime` with date and time and 2-nd column `custom_line_name` with y-coordinates. Length of the chart-line dataframes must be equal to the length of main candle series.")
1308
1309            # --- Volume chart options:
1310            volumeChart = figure(
1311                x_axis_type="datetime",
1312                y_axis_label="Volume",
1313                outline_line_width=3,
1314                outline_line_color="black" if darkTheme else "white",
1315                min_width=width,
1316                height=90,
1317                sizing_mode="scale_width",
1318                background_fill_color="black" if darkTheme else "white",
1319                tools=["pan", "wheel_zoom", "hover"],
1320                toolbar_location=None,
1321                active_scroll="wheel_zoom",
1322                min_border_left=0,
1323                min_border_right=0,
1324                min_border_top=0,
1325                min_border_bottom=0,
1326                x_range=chart.x_range,
1327                y_range=Range1d(0, max(self.prices.volume), bounds=(0, max(self.prices.volume))),
1328            )
1329            volumeChart.toolbar.logo = None  # remove bokeh logo and link to https://bokeh.org/
1330            volumeChart.xaxis.major_label_orientation = pi / 6
1331            volumeChart.xaxis.visible = False
1332            volumeChart.yaxis.formatter = NumeralTickFormatter(format="0a")
1333            volumeChart.grid.grid_line_dash = [6, 4]
1334            volumeChart.grid.grid_line_alpha = 0.5
1335            volumeChart.grid.minor_grid_line_dash = [6, 4]
1336            volumeChart.grid.minor_grid_line_alpha = 0.5
1337            volumeChart.xgrid.minor_grid_line_dash = [6, 4]
1338            volumeChart.xgrid.minor_grid_line_alpha = 0.3
1339            volumeChart.xgrid.minor_grid_line_color = "white" if darkTheme else "gray"
1340
1341            # preparing data for hover tooltips:
1342            volSource = {
1343                "candle": [x + 1 for x in range(-len(self.prices.close), 0, 1)],
1344                "datetime": self.prices.datetime,
1345                "volume": self.prices.volume,
1346                "zero": [0] * len(self.prices.volume),
1347            }

1349            volHover = volumeChart.select(dict(type=HoverTool))
1350            volHover.name = "volumes"
1351            volHover.tooltips = [
1352                ("Candle", "@candle"),
1353                ("Date", "@datetime{%Y-%m-%d}"),
1354                ("Time", "@datetime{%H:%M:%S}"),
1355                ("Volume", "@volume"),
1356            ]
1357            volHover.formatters = {
1358                "@datetime": "datetime",
1359            }
1360            volHover.point_policy = "snap_to_data"
1361            volHover.line_policy = "nearest"
1362            volHover.mode = "vline"
1363

1365            hoverOnVolumes = volumeChart.segment(

1367                color="black", line_alpha=0, name="volumes", source=volHoverData,
1368            )
1369            volHover.renderers = [hoverOnVolumes]  # hover on only for volume bars
1370            volumeChart.vbar(
1371                x=self.prices.datetime[inc], width=candleWidth, bottom=0, top=self.prices.volume[inc],
1372                fill_color="black" if darkTheme else "white", line_color="#20ff00" if darkTheme else "black",
1373                line_width=1, fill_alpha=1, line_alpha=1,
1374            )

1376                x=self.prices.datetime[dec], width=candleWidth, bottom=0, top=self.prices.volume[dec],
1377                fill_color="white" if darkTheme else "#999999", line_color="#20ff00" if darkTheme else "black",
1378                line_width=1, fill_alpha=1, line_alpha=1,

1397                        output_file(fileName, title=title, mode="cdn")
1398                        save(unionChart, fileName)
1399
1400                    except Exception as e:

1402

1404                        uLogger.info("Pandas DataFrame saved as HTML-file [{}]".format(os.path.abspath(fileName)))
1405

1411                            uLogger.info("Statistics saved to [{}]".format(os.path.abspath(mdFile)))

1416            return unionChart
1417
1418    def RenderGoogle(self, fileName: str = "index.html", viewInBrowser: bool = False, title: Optional[str] = None) -> None:
1419        """
1420        Rendering prices from Pandas DataFrame as non-interactive Google Candlestick chart and save it to HTML-file.
1421
1422        See also: https://developers.google.com/chart/interactive/docs/gallery/candlestickchart
1423
1424        :param fileName: HTML-file path to save Google Candlestick chart.
1425        :param viewInBrowser: If `True`, then immediately opens html in browser after rendering.
1426        :param title: specific chart title. If `None`, then used auto-generated title. `None` by default.
1427        """
1428        if self.prices is None or self.prices.empty:
1429            raise Exception("Empty price data! Generate or load prices before show as Google Candlestick chart!")
1430
1431        else:
1432            uLogger.info("Rendering Pandas DataFrame as Google Candlestick chart...")
1433
1434            self.DetectTimeframe()  # auto-detect time delta between last two neighbour candles
1435            infoBlock = self.GetStatistics()  # calculating some indicators
1436
1437            title = self._chartTitle if title is None or not title else title  # chart title
1438
1439            if self.j2model is None or not self.j2model:
1440                uLogger.debug("Preparing Google Candlestick chart configuration...")
1441                self.j2model = {"info": infoBlock, "title": title}
1442                googleDates = [pd.to_datetime(date).strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S") for date in self.prices.datetime.values]
1443                data = zip(googleDates, self.prices.low, self.prices.open, self.prices.close, self.prices.high)
1444                self.j2model["candlesData"] = [list(x) for x in data]
1445
1446            else:
1447                uLogger.debug("Using custom chart model")
1448
1449            # --- Rendering and saving chart as HTML-file and markdown-file with statistics:
1450            if os.path.exists(self.j2template):
1451                renderedTemplate = jinja2.Template(open(self.j2template, "r", encoding="UTF-8").read())
1452
1453            else:
1454                renderedTemplate = jinja2.Template(self.j2template)
1455
1456            htmlMain = renderedTemplate.render(self.j2model)
1457
1458            with open(fileName, "w", encoding="UTF-8") as fH:
1459                fH.write(htmlMain)
1460            with open("{}.md".format(fileName), "w", encoding="UTF-8") as fH:
1461                fH.write("\n".join(infoBlock))
1462
1463            if viewInBrowser:
1464                os.system(os.path.abspath(fileName))  # view forecast chart in default browser immediately
1465
1466            uLogger.info("Pandas DataFrame rendered as HTML-file [{}]".format(os.path.abspath(fileName)))
1467
1468
1469def ParseArgs():
1470    """This function get and parse command line keys."""
1471    parser = ArgumentParser()  # command-line string parser
1472
1473    parser.description = "PriceGenerator is the platform for generating prices similar to real stock prices, but you can control the statistics of their distribution. Generates chain of candlesticks with predefined statistical parameters, return Pandas DataFrame or saving as .CSV-file with OHLCV-candlestick in every string. Use PriceGenerator to generate synthetic data to test your trading strategy. See examples: https://tim55667757.github.io/PriceGenerator"
1474    parser.usage = "\n/as module/ python PriceGenerator.py [some options] [one command]\n/as CLI tool/ pricegenerator [some options] [one command]"
1475
1476    # options:
1477    parser.add_argument("--ticker", type=str, default="TEST", help="Option: some fake ticker name, 'TEST' by default.")
1478    parser.add_argument("--precision", type=int, default=2, help="Option: precision is count of digits after comma, 2 by default.")
1479    parser.add_argument("--timeframe", type=int, default=60, help="Option: time delta between two neighbour candles in minutes, 60 (1 hour) by default.")
1480    parser.add_argument("--start", type=str, help="Option: start time of 1st candle as string with format 'year-month-day hour:min', e.g. '2021-01-02 12:00'.")
1481    parser.add_argument("--horizon", type=int, default=30, help="Option: candlesticks count. Default: 30.")
1482    parser.add_argument("--split-trend", type=str, default="", help=r"Option: set different trends, e.g. `--split-trend=/\-` means that generated candles has uptrend at first part, next downtrend and then no trend. Used only together with `--split-count` key. Also, you can use words: `up`, `down`, `no` or chars: `u`, `d`, `n` with the hyphen symbol as separator, e.g. `--split-trend=up-down-no-up`, `--split-trend=u-d-n-u` etc. Default: empty string, mean that will be used random trend directions.")
1483    parser.add_argument("--split-count", type=int, nargs="+", help="Option: set candles count in different trends, e.g. `--split-count 5 10 15` means that generated candles has 3 trends with 5, 10 and 15 candles in chain, with sum must be equal to `--horizon` value. Used only together with `--split-trend` key. Default: [], empty list mean that will be used random candles count in trends.")
1484    parser.add_argument("--max-close", type=float, help="Option: maximum of all close prices.")
1485    parser.add_argument("--min-close", type=float, help="Option: minimum of all close prices.")
1486    parser.add_argument("--init-close", type=float, help="Option: generator started 1st open price equal to this last close price.")
1487    parser.add_argument("--max-outlier", type=float, help="Option: maximum of outlier size of candle tails, by default used (max_close - min_close) / 10.")
1488    parser.add_argument("--max-body", type=float, help="Option: maximum of candle body sizes: abs(open - close), by default used max_outlier * 0.9.")
1489    parser.add_argument("--max-volume", type=int, help="Option: maximum of trade volumes.")
1490    parser.add_argument("--up-candles-prob", type=float, default=0.5, help="Option: float number in [0; 1] is a probability that next candle is up, 0.5 by default.")
1491    parser.add_argument("--outliers-prob", type=float, default=0.03, help="Option: float number in [0; 1] is an outliers probability (price tails), 0.03 by default.")
1492    parser.add_argument("--trend-deviation", type=float, default=0.005, help="Option: relative deviation for trend detection, 0.005 mean 0.005 by default. No trend if (1st_close - last_close) / 1st_close <= trend_deviation.")
1493    parser.add_argument("--zigzag", type=float, default=0.03, help="Option: relative deviation to detection points of Zig-Zag indicator, 0.03 by default.")
1494    parser.add_argument("--sep", type=str, default=None, help="Option: separator in CSV-file, if None then auto-detecting enable.")
1495    parser.add_argument("--dark", action="store_true", default=False, help="Option: if key present, then will be used dark theme for the `--render-bokeh` key. `False` by default for light theme.")
1496    parser.add_argument("--debug-level", type=int, default=20, help="Option: showing STDOUT messages of minimal debug level, e.g., 10 = DEBUG, 20 = INFO, 30 = WARNING, 40 = ERROR, 50 = CRITICAL.")
1497
1498    # commands:
1499    parser.add_argument("--load-from", type=str, help="Command: load .cvs-file to Pandas DataFrame. You can draw chart in additional with `--render-bokeh` or `--render-google` key.")
1500    parser.add_argument("--generate", action="store_true", help="Command: generates chain of candlesticks with predefined statistical parameters and save stock history as Pandas DataFrame or .CSV-file if `--save-to` key is defined. You can draw chart in additional with `--render-bokeh` or `--render-google` keys.")
1501    parser.add_argument("--save-to", type=str, help="Command: save generated or loaded dataframe to .CSV-file. You can draw chart in additional with `--render-bokeh` or `--render-google` keys.")
1502    parser.add_argument("--render-bokeh", type=str, help="Command: show chain of candlesticks as interactive Bokeh chart. Used only together with `--load-from` or `--generate` keys.")
1503    parser.add_argument("--render-google", type=str, help="Command: show chain of candlesticks as non-interactive Google Candlestick chart. Used only together with `--load-from` or `--generate` keys.")
1504
1505    cmdArgs = parser.parse_args()
1506    return cmdArgs

1508
1509def Main():
1510    """
1511    Main function for work with PriceGenerator in the console.
1512
1513    See examples:
1514    - in english: https://github.com/Tim55667757/PriceGenerator/blob/master/README.md
1515    - in russian: https://github.com/Tim55667757/PriceGenerator/blob/master/README_RU.md
1516    """
1517    args = ParseArgs()  # get and parse command-line parameters
1518    exitCode = 0
1519
1520    if args.debug_level:
1521        uLogger.level = 10  # always debug level by default
1522        uLogger.handlers[0].level = args.debug_level  # level for STDOUT
1523        # uLogger.handlers[1].level = 10  # always debug level for log.txt
1524
1525    start = datetime.now(tzlocal())
1526    uLogger.debug(uLog.sepLine)
1527    uLogger.debug("PriceGenerator started: {}".format(start.strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")))
1528
1529    priceModel = PriceGenerator()
1530
1531    try:
1532        # --- set options:
1533
1534        if args.sep:
1535            priceModel.sep = args.sep  # separator in .CSV-file
1536
1537        if args.ticker:
1538            priceModel.ticker = args.ticker  # some fake ticker name, "TEST" by default
1539
1540        if int(args.precision) >= 0:
1541            priceModel.precision = args.precision  # precision is count of digits after comma, 2 by default
1542
1543        if args.timeframe:
1544            priceModel.timeframe = timedelta(minutes=args.timeframe)  # time delta between two neighbour candles in minutes, 60 (1 hour) by default
1545
1546        if args.start:
1547            priceModel.timeStart = pd.to_datetime(args.start, format="%Y-%m-%d %H:%M")
1548
1549        if args.horizon:
1550            priceModel.horizon = args.horizon  # generating candlesticks count
1551
1552        if args.split_trend:
1553            priceModel.trendSplit = args.split_trend  # difference periods
1554
1555        if args.split_count:
1556            priceModel.splitCount = args.split_count  # candles in every period
1557
1558        if args.min_close:
1559            priceModel.minClose = args.min_close  # minimum of all close prices
1560
1561        if args.init_close:
1562            priceModel.initClose = args.init_close  # generator started 1st open price of chain from this "last" close price
1563
1564        if args.max_outlier:
1565            priceModel.maxOutlier = args.max_outlier  # maximum of outlier size of candle tails, by default used (max-close - min-close) / 10
1566
1567        if args.max_body:
1568            priceModel.maxCandleBody = args.max_body  # maximum of candle body sizes: abs(open - close), by default used max-outlier * 90%
1569
1570        if args.max_volume:
1571            priceModel.maxVolume = args.max_volume  # maximum of trade volumes
1572
1573        if args.up_candles_prob:
1574            priceModel.upCandlesProb = args.up_candles_prob  # float number in [0; 1] is a probability that next candle is up, 0.5 = 50% by default
1575
1576        if args.outliers_prob:
1577            priceModel.outliersProb = args.outliers_prob  # float number in [0; 1] is a statistical outlier probability (price "tails"), 0.03 = 3% by default
1578
1579        if args.trend_deviation:
1580            priceModel.trendDeviation = args.trend_deviation  # relative deviation for trend detection, 0.005 mean 0.5% by default. "NO trend" if (1st_close - last_close) / 1st_close <= trend-deviation
1581
1582        if args.zigzag:
1583            priceModel.zigZagDeviation = args.zigzag  # relative deviation to detection points of ZigZag indicator, 0.03 by default
1584
1585        # --- do one or more commands:
1586
1587        if not args.load_from and not args.generate and not args.save_to and not args.render_bokeh:
1588            raise Exception("At least one command must be selected! See: python PriceGenerator.py --help")
1589
1590        if args.load_from:
1591            priceModel.LoadFromFile(fileName=args.load_from)
1592
1593        if args.generate:
1594            priceModel.Generate()
1595
1596        if args.save_to:
1597            priceModel.SaveToFile(fileName=args.save_to)
1598
1599        if args.render_bokeh:
1600            priceModel.RenderBokeh(
1601                fileName=args.render_bokeh,
1602                viewInBrowser=True,
1603                darkTheme=args.dark,
1604                width=1800,
1605                height=940,
1606                showControlsOnChart=True,
1607                showStatOnChart=True,
1608                inline=False,
1609            )
1610
1611        if args.render_google:
1612            priceModel.RenderGoogle(
1613                fileName=args.render_google,
1614                viewInBrowser=True,
1615            )
1616
1617    except Exception as e:
1618        uLogger.error(e)
1619        exc = tb.format_exc().split("\n")
1620        for line in exc:
1621            if line:
1622                uLogger.debug(line)
1623        exitCode = 255
1624
1625    finally:
1626        finish = datetime.now(tzlocal())
1627
1628        if exitCode == 0:
1629            uLogger.debug("All PriceGenerator operations are finished success (summary code is 0).")
1630
1631        else:
1632            uLogger.error("An errors occurred during the work! See full debug log with --debug-level 10. Summary code: {}".format(exitCode))
1633
1634        uLogger.debug("PriceGenerator work duration: {}".format(finish - start))
1635        uLogger.debug("PriceGenerator work finished: {}".format(finish.strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")))
1636
1637        sys.exit(exitCode)
1638
1639
1640if __name__ == "__main__":
1641    Main()

 235

 237        """Dictionary of variables for jinja2 template. If `None` then used default variables for internal `GOOGLE_TEMPLATE_J2`"""
 238
 239        self._precision = 2
 240        """Signs after comma. Default: `2`."""
 241
 242        self._deg10prec = 100
 243        """Constant 10^precision is used by some formulas. Not recommended to change it. Default: `100` (`10 ** precision`)."""

 246        """Some fake ticker name. Default: `Test`."""

 248        self.timeframe = timedelta(hours=1)
 249        """Time delta between two neighbour candles. Default: `timedelta(hours=1)`."""
 250
 251        self.timeStart = datetime.now(tzlocal()).replace(microsecond=0, second=0, minute=0)
 252        """First date and time for candles chain."""

 255        """Candlesticks count in generated or loaded chain of prices, must be >= 5. Default: `None` (means auto-detect length of chain if loaded from file)."""
 256
 257        self.trendSplit = ""
 258        r"""Set different trends, e.g. `trendSplit="/\-"` means that generated candles has uptrend at first part, next downtrend and then no trend. Used only together with `splitCount` variable. Also, you can use words: `up`, `down`, `no` or chars: `u`, `d`, `n` with the hyphen symbol as separator, e.g. `trendSplit=up-down-no-up`, `trendSplit=u-d-n-u` etc. Default: `""`, empty string mean that will be used random trend directions."""
 259
 260        self.splitCount = []
 261        """Set candles count in different trends, e.g. `splitCount=[5, 10, 15]` means that generated candles has 3 trends with 5, 10 and 15 candles in chain, with sum must be equal to horizon. Used only together with `trendSplit` variable. Default: `[]`, empty list mean that will be used random candles count in trends."""
 262
 263        self.maxClose = random.uniform(70, 90)
 264        """Maximum of close prices must be >= `minClose`. Default: random in interval `(70, 90)`."""
 265
 266        self.minClose = random.uniform(60, 70)
 267        """Minimum of close prices must be <= `maxClose`. Default: random in interval `(60, 70)`."""
 268
 269        self.initClose = None
 270        """First candle close price value. If `None` then used random number in interval between `minClose` and `maxClose`. Default: `None`."""

 272        self.maxOutlier = None
 273        """Maximum size of outliers. If `None` then used value `(maxClose - minClose) / 10`. Default: `None`."""

 276        """Maximum of candle body sizes: `abs(open - close)`. If `None` then used value `maxOutlier * 90%`. Default: `None`."""
 277
 278        self._maxVolume = random.randint(0, 100000)
 279        """Maximum of generated trade volumes. Default: random in interval `(0, 100000)`."""
 280
 281        self._upCandlesProb = 0.5
 282        """Probability that next candle is up. Default: `0.5` (means 50% of probability)."""
 283
 284        self._outliersProb = 0.03
 285        """Outlier probability (price tails). Default: `0.03` (means 3% of probability)."""
 286
 287        self._trendDeviation = 0.005
 288        """Relative deviation for trend detection. "NO trend" if `(1st_close - last_close) / 1st_close <= self.trendDeviation`. Default: `0.005` (means 0.5% of price deviation)."""
 289
 290        self._chartTitle = ""
 291        """Chart title. It will be auto-generated when loading or creating chain of candlesticks."""
 292
 293        self._zigZagDeviation = 0.03
 294        """Relative deviation to detection next points used by Zig-Zag indicator. Default: `0.03` (means 3% of price deviation)."""
 295
 296        self._stat = {
 297            "candles": 0,  # generated candlesticks count
 298            "precision": 2,  # generated candlesticks count
 299            "closeFirst": 0.,  # first close price
 300            "closeLast": 0.,  # last close price
 301            "closeMax": 0.,  # max close price
 302            "closeMix": 0.,  # min close price
 303            "diapason": 0.,  # diapason = closeMax - closeMin
 304            "trend": "NO trend",  # "UP trend" or "DOWN trend" with uses self.trendDeviation
 305            "trendDev": 0.005,
 306            "upCount": 0,  # count of up candles
 307            "downCount": 0,  # count of down candles
 308            "upCountChainMax": 0,  # max chain count of up candles
 309            "downCountChainMax": 0,  # max chain count of down candles
 310            "deltas": {
 311                "max": 0.,  # delta max = max(close_prices)
 312                "min": 0.,  # delta min = min(close_prices)

 314                "q99": 0.,  # 99 percentile
 315                "q95": 0.,  # 95 percentile
 316                "q80": 0.,  # 80 percentile
 317                "q50": 0.,  # 50 percentile
 318            },
 319            "cumSumVolumes": 0  # cumulative sum of volumes
 320        }
 321        """Some statistics available after candles loaded or generated."""

 334            self._upCandlesProb = 1

 394    @precision.setter

 396        self._precision = 2  # default
 397        self._deg10prec = 100  # default

 401                self._precision = value
 402                self._deg10prec = 10 ** value  # 10^precision

 411        if value is None or value < 0:
 412            self._zigZagDeviation = 0.03  # by default
 413
 414        elif value > 1:
 415            self._zigZagDeviation = 1
 416
 417        else:
 418            self._zigZagDeviation = value
