 420    @staticmethod
 421    def FormattedDelta(tDelta: timedelta, fmt: str) -> str:
 422        """
 423        Pretty format for timedelta objects.
 424
 425        Example: `FormattedDelta(timedelta(days=2, hours=3, minutes=15, seconds=35), "{days} days {hours}:{minutes}:{seconds}") -> "2 days 3:15:35"`.
 426
 427        :return: timedelta object formatted as a string.
 428        """
 429        d = {"days": tDelta.days}
 430        d["hours"], rem = divmod(tDelta.seconds, 3600)
 431        d["minutes"], d["seconds"] = divmod(rem, 60)
 432
 433        return fmt.format(**d)
 434
 435    def DetectPrecision(self, examples: Union[np.ndarray, pd.Series, list]) -> int:
 436        """
 437        Auto-detect precision from example values. E.g. `0.123 -> 3`, `0.12345 -> 5` and so on.
 438        This method change `precision` variable after detect precision.
 439
 440        See also about statistics.mode: https://docs.python.org/3.9/library/statistics.html#statistics.mode
 441        Changed in Python version >= 3.8: Now mode() method handles multimodal datasets by returning the first mode encountered.
 442        Previously, it raised StatisticsError when more than one mode was found.
 443
 444        :param examples: chain with examples of float values.
 445        """
 446        uLogger.debug("Detecting precision of data values...")
 447        precision = 0
 448        try:
 449            precision = mode(list(map(lambda x: len(str(x).split('.')[-1]) if len(str(x).split('.')) > 1 else 0, examples))) if self.precision >= 0 else 0
 450
 451        except StatisticsError as e:
 452            uLogger.debug("Statistic mode() method return an error! Precision is set to 2 (default). StatisticsError: '{}'".format(e))
 453            precision = 2
 454
 455        finally:
 456            uLogger.debug("Auto-detected precision: {}".format(precision))
 457
 458        self.precision = precision
 459
 460        return precision
 461
 462    def DetectTimeframe(self) -> timedelta:
 463        """
 464        Auto-detect time delta between last two neighbour candles.
 465
 466        :return: timedelta object, also saved to `timeframe`.
 467        """
 468        self.timeframe = min(
 469            self.prices.iloc[-1].datetime - self.prices.iloc[-2].datetime,
 470            self.prices.iloc[-2].datetime - self.prices.iloc[-3].datetime
 471        )
 472        uLogger.debug("Auto-detected timeframe: {}".format(self.timeframe))
 473
 474        return self.timeframe
 475
 476    def LoadFromFile(self, fileName: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
 477        """
 478        Create Pandas OHLCV-model from CSV-file.
 479        Default columns in CSV-file are `["date", "time", "open", "high", "low", "close", "volume"]`.
 480
 481        :param fileName: path to CSV-file with OHLCV columns.
 482        :return: Pandas DataFrame.
 483        """
 484        uLogger.info("Loading, parse and preparing input data from [{}]...".format(os.path.abspath(fileName)))
 485
 486        self.prices = pd.read_csv(fileName, names=self.csvHeaders, engine="python", sep=self.sep, parse_dates={"datetime": ["date", "time"]})
 487        if self.horizon is None or self.horizon < 1 or self.horizon > len(self.prices):
 488            self.horizon = len(self.prices)  # use loaded file "as is" with all candles
 489
 490        else:
 491            self.prices = self.prices.tail(self.horizon)  # remove old candles, leave only the "tail" ...
 492            self.prices.index = range(self.horizon)  # ... and reindex
 493
 494        self.ticker = os.path.basename(fileName)
 495
 496        self.DetectTimeframe()  # auto-detect time delta between last two neighbour candles
 497
 498        uLogger.info("It was read {} rows".format(self.horizon))
 499        uLogger.info("Showing last 5 rows as Pandas DataFrame:")
 500        for line in pd.DataFrame.to_string(self.prices[self.dfHeaders][-5:], max_cols=20).split("\n"):
 501            uLogger.info(line)
 502
 503        return self.prices
 504
 505    def SaveToFile(self, fileName: str) -> None:
 506        """
 507        Save Pandas OHLCV model to CSV-file.
 508
 509        :param fileName: path to CSV-file.
 510        """
 511        if self.prices is not None and not self.prices.empty:
 512            uLogger.info("Saving [{}] rows of Pandas DataFrame with columns: {}...".format(len(self.prices), self.csvHeaders))
 513            uLogger.debug("Delimeter: {}".format(self.sep))
 514            dataReplacedDateTime = self.prices.copy(deep=True)
 515            dataReplacedDateTime["date"] = [d.date() for d in dataReplacedDateTime["datetime"]]
 516            dataReplacedDateTime["time"] = [d.time() for d in dataReplacedDateTime["datetime"]]
 517            del dataReplacedDateTime["datetime"]
 518            dataReplacedDateTime = dataReplacedDateTime[self.csvHeaders]
 519            dataReplacedDateTime.to_csv(fileName, sep=self.sep, index=False, header=False)
 520            uLogger.info("Pandas DataFrame saved to .CSV-file [{}]".format(os.path.abspath(fileName)))
 521
 522        else:
 523            raise Exception("Empty price data! Generate or load prices before saving!")
 524
 525    @staticmethod
 526    def GetTrend(firstClose: float, lastClose: float, trendDeviation: float = 0.005) -> str:
 527        """
 528        Get string with trend: `"UP trend"`, `"DOWN trend"` or `"NO trend"`.
 529
 530        :param firstClose: close of first candle.
 531        :param lastClose: close of last candle.
 532        :param trendDeviation: relative deviation for trend detection, 0.005 mean 0.5% by default.
 533        :return: string with trend direction `"NO trend"`, `"UP trend"` or `"DOWN trend"`.
 534        """
 535        if abs(firstClose - lastClose) / firstClose <= trendDeviation:
 536            trend = "NO trend"
 537
 538        else:
 539            trend = "UP trend" if firstClose <= lastClose else "DOWN trend"
 540
 541        return trend
 542
 543    @staticmethod
 544    def ZigZagFilter(datetimes: pd.Series, values: Union[pd.Series, list], deviation: float) -> dict:
 545        """
 546        This method filter input data as Zig-Zag indicator: when input value of candlestick price (e.g. close price)
 547        is difference with next values with define percent then this point is a point of Zig-Zag indicator.
 548
 549        :param datetimes: input Pandas Series with datetime values.
 550        :param values: input Pandas Series or list, e.g. list of closes values of candlesticks.
 551        :param deviation: float number in `[0, 1]` interval is a relative difference between `i` and `i + 1` values to set as Zig-Zag point.
 552        :return: dict with Pandas Series filtered data `{"datetimes": filtered_datetimes, "filtered": filtered_values}`.
 553        """
 554        filteredPoints = [True]
 555        prev = values[0]
 556        for i in range(1, len(values)):
 557            difference = abs(values[i] - prev) / prev
 558            if difference >= deviation:
 559                filteredPoints.append(True)
 560                prev = values[i]
 561
 562            else:
 563                filteredPoints.append(False)
 564
 565        return {"datetimes": datetimes[filteredPoints], "filtered": values[filteredPoints]}
 566
 567    def GetStatistics(self) -> list[str]:
 568        """
 569        Calculates statistics of candles chain.
 570
 571        :return: list with text in Markdown format with statistics.
 572        """
 573        uLogger.debug("Calculating column with deltas between high and low values...")
 574        self.prices["delta"] = self.prices.high.values - self.prices.low.values
 575
 576        uLogger.debug("Calculating column with average values...")
 577        self.prices["avg"] = round((self.prices.high + self.prices.low) / 2, self._precision)
 578
 579        uLogger.debug("Calculating some technical analysis indicators...")
 580        self.prices["sma5"] = ta.sma(close=self.prices.close, length=5, offset=None)
 581        self.prices["sma20"] = ta.sma(close=self.prices.close, length=20, offset=None)
 582        self.prices["sma50"] = ta.sma(close=self.prices.close, length=50, offset=None)
 583        self.prices["sma200"] = ta.sma(close=self.prices.close, length=200, offset=None)
 584        self.prices["hma5"] = ta.hma(close=self.prices.close, length=5, offset=None)
 585        self.prices["hma20"] = ta.hma(close=self.prices.close, length=20, offset=None)
 586        self.prices["vwma5"] = ta.vwma(close=self.prices.close, volume=self.prices.volume, length=5, offset=None)
 587        self.prices["vwma20"] = ta.vwma(close=self.prices.close, volume=self.prices.volume, length=20, offset=None)
 588        bbands = ta.bbands(close=self.prices.close, length=None, std=None, mamode=None, offset=None)
 589        bbands.columns = ["lower", "mid", "upper", "bandwidth", "percent"]
 590        psar = ta.psar(high=self.prices.high, low=self.prices.low, close=self.prices.close, af=0.02, max_af=0.2, offset=None)
 591        psar.columns = ["long", "short", "af", "reversal"]
 592        self.prices["hma13"] = ta.hma(close=self.prices.close, length=13, offset=8)  # alligator Jaw
 593        self.prices["hma8"] = ta.hma(close=self.prices.close, length=8, offset=5)  # alligator Teeth
 594        self.prices["hma5"] = ta.hma(close=self.prices.close, length=5, offset=3)  # alligator Lips
 595        zigzag = self.ZigZagFilter(datetimes=self.prices.datetime, values=self.prices.close, deviation=self.zigZagDeviation)  # ZigZag indicator
 596
 597        self.DetectPrecision(self.prices.close.values)  # auto-detect precision
 598
 599        self._chartTitle = "Instrument: {}, timeframe: {}, horizon length: {} (from {} to {})".format(
 600            self.ticker,
 601            self.FormattedDelta(
 602                self.timeframe, "{days} days {hours}h {minutes}m {seconds}s"
 603            ) if self.timeframe >= timedelta(days=1) else self.FormattedDelta(
 604                self.timeframe, "{hours}h {minutes}m {seconds}s"
 605            ),
 606            self.horizon,
 607            pd.to_datetime(self.prices.datetime.values[0]).strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"),
 608            pd.to_datetime(self.prices.datetime.values[-1]).strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"),
 609        )
 610
 611        self._stat["candles"] = len(self.prices)
 612        self._stat["precision"] = self.precision
 613        self._stat["closeFirst"] = self.prices.close.values[0]
 614        self._stat["closeLast"] = self.prices.close.values[-1]
 615        self._stat["closeMax"] = pd.DataFrame.max(self.prices.close)
 616        self._stat["closeMin"] = pd.DataFrame.min(self.prices.close)
 617        self._stat["diapason"] = self._stat["closeMax"] - self._stat["closeMin"]
 618        self._stat["trend"] = self.GetTrend(firstClose=self._stat["closeFirst"], lastClose=self._stat["closeLast"], trendDeviation=self.trendDeviation)
 619
 620        self.prices["up"] = self.prices.close >= self.prices.open  # True mean that is up candle, and False mean down
 621        upList = list(self.prices.up)
 622        upChainsLengths = [len(list(chain)) for value, chain in groupby(upList) if value is True]
 623        downChainsLengths = [len(list(chain)) for value, chain in groupby(upList) if value is False]
 624
 625        self._stat["trendDev"] = self.trendDeviation
 626        self._stat["upCount"] = len(self.prices.up[self.prices.up == True])
 627        self._stat["downCount"] = len(self.prices.up[self.prices.up == False])
 628        self._stat["upCountChainMax"] = max(upChainsLengths) if upChainsLengths else 1
 629        self._stat["downCountChainMax"] = max(downChainsLengths) if downChainsLengths else 1
 630        self._stat["deltas"]["max"] = pd.DataFrame.max(self.prices.delta)
 631        self._stat["deltas"]["min"] = pd.DataFrame.min(self.prices.delta)
 632        self._stat["deltas"]["stDev"] = round(pstdev(self.prices.delta), self._precision)
 633        self._stat["deltas"]["q99"] = round(max(pd.DataFrame(self.prices.delta).quantile(q=0.99, interpolation='linear')), self._precision)
 634        self._stat["deltas"]["q95"] = round(max(pd.DataFrame(self.prices.delta).quantile(q=0.95, interpolation='linear')), self._precision)
 635        self._stat["deltas"]["q80"] = round(max(pd.DataFrame(self.prices.delta).quantile(q=0.80, interpolation='linear')), self._precision)
 636        self._stat["deltas"]["q50"] = round(max(pd.DataFrame(self.prices.delta).quantile(q=0.50, interpolation='linear')), self._precision)
 637        self._stat["cumSumVolumes"] = self.prices.volume.sum()
 638
 639        self._stat["sma5"] = self.prices["sma5"]
 640        self._stat["sma20"] = self.prices["sma20"]
 641        self._stat["sma50"] = self.prices["sma50"]
 642        self._stat["sma200"] = self.prices["sma200"]
 643        self._stat["hma5"] = self.prices["hma5"]
 644        self._stat["hma20"] = self.prices["hma20"]
 645        self._stat["vwma5"] = self.prices["vwma5"]
 646        self._stat["vwma20"] = self.prices["vwma20"]
 647        self._stat["bbands"] = bbands
 648        self._stat["psar"] = psar
 649        self._stat["hma13"] = self.prices["hma13"]
 650        self._stat["hma8"] = self.prices["hma8"]
 651        self._stat["hma5"] = self.prices["hma5"]
 652        self._stat["zigzag3"] = zigzag
 653
 654        summary = [
 655            "# Summary",
 656            "- Candles count: {}".format(self.stat["candles"]),
 657            "- Timeframe: {}".format(self.timeframe),
 658            "- Precision (signs after comma): {}".format(self.stat["precision"]),
 659            "- Close, first: {}".format(round(self.stat["closeFirst"], self.precision)),
 660            "- Close, last: {}".format(round(self.stat["closeLast"], self.precision)),
 661            "- Close, max: {}".format(round(self.stat["closeMax"], self.precision)),
 662            "- Close, min: {}".format(round(self.stat["closeMin"], self.precision)),
 663            "- Diapason, |close_max - close_min|: {}".format(round(self.stat["diapason"], self.precision)),
 664            "- Trend, |close_1st - close_last|: {}".format(self.stat["trend"]),
 665            "",
 666            "# Statistics",
 667            "- Up candles count: {} ({}%)".format(self.stat["upCount"], round(100 * self.stat["upCount"] / self.stat["candles"], self.precision)),
 668            "- Down candles count: {} ({}%)".format(self.stat["downCount"], round(100 * self.stat["downCount"] / self.stat["candles"], self.precision)),
 669            "- Max of up / down candle chains: {} / {}".format(self.stat["upCountChainMax"], self.stat["downCountChainMax"]),
 670            "- Max delta, |high - low|: {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["max"], self.precision)),
 671            "- Min delta, |high - low|: {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["min"], self.precision)),
 672            "- Delta's std. dev.: {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["stDev"], self.precision)),
 673            "  - 99 percentile:  {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["q99"], self.precision)),
 674            "  - 95 percentile:  {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["q95"], self.precision)),
 675            "  - 80 percentile:  {}".format(round(self.stat["deltas"]["q80"], self.precision)),
 676            "- Cumulative sum of volumes: {}".format(self.stat["cumSumVolumes"]),
 677        ]
 678
 679        uLogger.info("Some statistics:\n{}".format("\n".join(summary)))
 680
 681        return summary
 682
 683    def _GenNextCandle(self, lastClose) -> dict:
 684        """
 685        Generator for creating 1 next candle based on global probability parameters.
 686
 687        :param lastClose: value of last close price.
 688        :return: one OHLCV-candle as dict.
 689        """
 690        candle = {
 691            "open": lastClose,
 692            "high": 0,
 693            "low": 0,
 694            "close": 0,
 695            "volume": random.randint(a=0, b=self.maxVolume)
 696        }
 697
 698        if random.random() <= self.upCandlesProb:
 699            maxBody = min(self.maxClose, candle["open"] + self.maxCandleBody)
 700            candle["close"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["open"], b=maxBody), self.precision)  # up candle
 701
 702            if random.random() <= self.outliersProb:
 703                candle["high"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["close"], b=candle["close"] + self.maxOutlier), self.precision)  # with outlier price "tails"
 704                candle["low"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["open"] - self.maxOutlier, b=candle["open"]), self.precision)
 705
 706            else:
 707                halfBody = (candle["close"] - candle["open"]) / 2
 708                candle["high"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["close"], b=candle["close"] + halfBody), self.precision)  # without outlier price "tails"
 709                candle["low"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["open"] - halfBody, b=candle["open"]), self.precision)
 710
 711        else:
 712            minBody = max(self.minClose, candle["open"] - self.maxCandleBody)
 713            candle["close"] = round(random.uniform(a=minBody, b=candle["open"]), self.precision)  # down candle
 714
 715            if random.random() <= self.outliersProb:
 716                candle["high"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["open"], b=candle["open"] + self.maxOutlier), self.precision)  # with outlier price "tails"
 717                candle["low"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["close"] - self.maxOutlier, b=candle["close"]), self.precision)
 718
 719            else:
 720                halfBody = (candle["open"] - candle["close"]) / 2
 721                candle["high"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["open"], b=candle["open"] + halfBody), self.precision)  # without outlier price "tails"
 722                candle["low"] = round(random.uniform(a=candle["close"] - halfBody, b=candle["close"]), self.precision)
 723
 724        return candle
 725
 726    def Generate(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 727        """
 728        Main method to generating prices.
 729
 730        :return Pandas DataFrame object with OHLCV-candlestick in every row and also saving it to the `prices`.
 731        """
 732        if self.horizon is None or self.horizon < 5:
 733            self.horizon = 5
 734            uLogger.debug("Horizon length less than 5! It is set to 5 by default.")
 735
 736        if self.trendSplit is not None and self.splitCount is not None:
 737            # Detecting input trend:
 738            self.trendSplit = self.trendSplit.lower()
 739            if "/" in self.trendSplit or "\\" in self.trendSplit:
 740                uLogger.debug("Detected old-style string for split trend: {}".format(self.trendSplit))
 741
 742                self.trendSplit = self.trendSplit.replace("-", "-no-").replace("/", "-up-").replace("\\", "-down-").replace("--", "-").lstrip("-").rstrip("-")
 743
 744            else:
 745                uLogger.debug("Detected new-style string for split trend: {}".format(self.trendSplit))
 746
 747                self.trendSplit = "-{}-".format(self.trendSplit)
 748                self.trendSplit = self.trendSplit.replace("-u-", "-up-").replace("-d-", "-down-").replace("-n-", "-no-").lstrip("-").rstrip("-")
 749
 750            uLogger.debug("New style string for trend split is set: {}".format(self.trendSplit))
 751
 752            trends = self.trendSplit.split("-")
 753
 754            uLogger.debug("Trends list: {}".format(trends))
 755
 756            if len(trends) > self.horizon:
 757                trends = trends[0]
 758
 759                uLogger.debug("Trend parts count ({}) must be less than horizon ({})! New trend will be used: {}".format(len(trends), self.horizon, trends[0]))
 760
 761            if sum(self.splitCount) != self.horizon or len(trends) == 1:
 762                self.splitCount = [self.horizon]
 763
 764                uLogger.debug("Only one trend will be used with length equal to horizon: {}".format(self.splitCount))
 765
 766            if len(self.splitCount) != len(trends):
 767                self.trendSplit = None
 768                self.splitCount = None
 769
 770                uLogger.debug("Random trend direction will be used, because trends count not equal to split count!")
 771
 772        else:
 773            trends = []
 774
 775        # maximum of candle sizes: (high - low), if None then used (maxClose - minClose) / 10
 776        if self.maxOutlier is None:
 777            self.maxOutlier = (self.maxClose - self.minClose) / 10
 778
 779        # maximum of candle body sizes: abs(open - close), if None then used maxOutlier * 90%
 780        if self.maxCandleBody is None:
 781            self.maxCandleBody = 0.9 * self.maxOutlier
 782
 783        # initClose is the last close price (left on chart or "before" 1st generated candle), 1st candle["open"] = initClose
 784        if self.initClose is None:
 785            self.initClose = round(random.uniform(a=self.minClose, b=self.maxClose), self.precision)
 786
 787        uLogger.info("Generating prices...")
 788        uLogger.debug("- Ticker name: {}".format(self.ticker))
 789        uLogger.debug("- Precision: {}".format(self.precision))
 790        uLogger.debug("- Interval or timeframe (time delta between two neighbour candles): {}".format(self.timeframe))
 791        uLogger.debug("- Horizon length (candlesticks count): {}".format(self.horizon))
 792        if self.trendSplit is not None and self.trendSplit and self.splitCount is not None and self.splitCount:
 793            uLogger.debug("- Trend type: {}".format(self.trendSplit))
 794            uLogger.debug("- Candlesticks count in every mini-trend: {}".format(self.splitCount))
 795
 796        uLogger.debug("- Start time: {}".format(self.timeStart.strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")))
 797        uLogger.debug("  |-> end time: {}".format((self.timeStart + self.horizon * self.timeframe).strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")))
 798        uLogger.debug("- Maximum of close prices: {}".format(round(self.maxClose, self.precision)))
 799        uLogger.debug("- Minimum of close prices: {}".format(round(self.minClose, self.precision)))
 800        uLogger.debug("- Maximum of candle body sizes: {}".format(round(self.maxCandleBody, self.precision)))
 801        uLogger.debug("- Maximum of candle tails outlier sizes: {}".format(round(self.maxOutlier, self.precision)))
 802        uLogger.debug("- Init close (1st open price in chain): {}".format(round(self.initClose, self.precision)))
 803        uLogger.debug("- Maximum of volume of one candle: {}".format(self.maxVolume))
 804        uLogger.debug("- Probability that next candle is up: {}%".format(self.upCandlesProb * 100))
 805        uLogger.debug("- Statistical outliers probability: {}%".format(self.outliersProb * 100))
 806
 807        # -- Preparing candles chain:
 808        if self.trendSplit is not None and self.trendSplit and self.splitCount is not None and self.splitCount:
 809            userProb = self.upCandlesProb
 810            userHorizon = self.horizon
 811            userInitC = self.initClose
 812            candles = []
 813
 814            for trendNum in range(len(trends)):
 815                self.horizon = self.splitCount[trendNum]
 816                self.initClose = candles[-1]["close"] if trendNum > 0 else self.initClose
 817
 818                # change probability of candles direction in next trend:
 819                if trends[trendNum] == "up":
 820                    self.upCandlesProb = 0.51 if userProb <= 0.5 else userProb
 821
 822                elif trends[trendNum] == "down":
 823                    self.upCandlesProb = 0.49 if userProb >= 0.5 else userProb
 824
 825                elif trends[trendNum] == "no":
 826                    self.upCandlesProb = 0.5
 827
 828                else:
 829                    uLogger.error("Unknown direction used: {}".format(trends[trendNum]))
 830
 831                    raise Exception("Unknown direction")
 832
 833                firstCandle = self._GenNextCandle(round(self.initClose, self.precision))  # first candle in next trend
 834                candles.append(firstCandle)
 835
 836                for _ in range(1, self.horizon):
 837                    candles.append(self._GenNextCandle(candles[-1]["close"]))
 838
 839                highDelta = abs(candles[-1]["high"] - max(candles[-1]["open"], candles[-1]["close"]))  # save higher shadow
 840                lowDelta = abs(min(candles[-1]["open"], candles[-1]["close"]) - candles[-1]["low"])  # save lower shadow
 841
 842                # -- Change last candle in every trend:
 843                if trends[trendNum] == "up":
 844                    if firstCandle["close"] >= candles[-1]["close"]:
 845                        candles[-1]["close"] = round(random.uniform(a=firstCandle["close"], b=self.maxClose), self.precision)
 846
 847                elif trends[trendNum] == "down":
 848                    if firstCandle["close"] < candles[-1]["close"]:
 849                        candles[-1]["close"] = round(random.uniform(a=self.minClose, b=firstCandle["close"]), self.precision)
 850
 851                else:  # if NO trend:
 852                    if abs(firstCandle["close"] - candles[-1]["close"]) / firstCandle["close"] > self.trendDeviation:
 853                        candles[-1]["close"] = round(
 854                            random.uniform(
 855                                a=firstCandle["close"] - firstCandle["close"] * self.trendDeviation / 2,
 856                                b=firstCandle["close"] + firstCandle["close"] * self.trendDeviation / 2,
 857                            ),
 858                            self.precision,
 859                        )
 860
 861                candles[-1]["high"] = max(candles[-1]["open"], candles[-1]["close"]) + highDelta  # fixing higher shadow
 862                candles[-1]["low"] = min(candles[-1]["open"], candles[-1]["close"]) - lowDelta  # fixing lower shadow
 863
 864            self.upCandlesProb = userProb
 865            self.horizon = userHorizon
 866            self.initClose = userInitC
 867
 868        else:
 869            candles = [self._GenNextCandle(round(self.initClose, self.precision))]  # first candle in chain
 870            for _ in range(1, self.horizon):
 871                candles.append(self._GenNextCandle(candles[-1]["close"]))
 872
 873        # prepare Dataframe from generated prices:
 874        indx = pd.date_range(
 875            start=self.timeStart,
 876            end=self.timeStart + (self.horizon - 1) * self.timeframe,
 877            freq=self.timeframe,
 878            tz=tzlocal(),
 879        )
 880        self.prices = pd.DataFrame(data=candles, columns=self.dfHeaders)
 881        self.prices.datetime = indx
 882
 883        uLogger.info("Showing last 5 rows of Pandas generated dataframe object:")
 884        for line in pd.DataFrame.to_string(self.prices[self.dfHeaders][-5:], max_cols=20).split("\n"):
 885            uLogger.info(line)
 886
 887        return self.prices
 888
 889    def RenderBokeh(
 890            self, fileName: Optional[str] = "index.html", viewInBrowser: bool = False,
 891            darkTheme: bool = False, markers: Optional[pd.DataFrame] = None, lines: Optional[list[pd.DataFrame]] = None,
 892            title: Optional[str] = None, width: Optional[int] = 1800, height: Optional[int] = 940,
 893            showControlsOnChart: bool = True, showStatOnChart: bool = True, inline: bool = False,
 894    ) -> Optional[gridplot]:
 895        """
 896        Rendering prices from Pandas DataFrame as OHLCV Bokeh chart of candlesticks and save it to HTML-file.
 897        Pandas DataFrame in `prices` variable must contain "datetime", "open", "high", "low", "close" and "volume" columns.
 898
 899        See also: https://docs.bokeh.org/en/latest/docs/gallery/candlestick.html
 900
 901        :param fileName: HTML-file path to save Bokeh chart. `index.html` by default.
 902        :param viewInBrowser: If `True`, then immediately opens HTML chart in browser after rendering. `False` by default.
 903        :param darkTheme: chart theme. `False` by default, mean that will be used light theme, `False` mean dark theme.
 904        :param markers: Pandas DataFrame with additional markers that will be placed on main series. `None` by default.
 905                        Marker is a custom symbol, example: ,  or . Dataframe with markers must contain at least two columns.
 906                        There are `datetime` with date and time and some markers columns (`markersUpper`, `markersCenter` or `markersLower`).
 907                        Length of markers series must be equal to the length of main candles series.
 908        :param lines: list with custom series, where additional chart-lines will place on main series. `None` by default.
 909                      Line data must contain at least two columns. There are `datetime` with date and time and
 910                      `custom_line_name` with y-coordinates. Length of the chart-line dataframes must be equal to the length of main candle series.
 911        :param title: specific chart title. If `None`, then used auto-generated title. `None` by default.
 912        :param width: chart width. If `None`, then used auto-width. 1800 px by default.
 913        :param height: chart height. If `None`, then used auto-height. 940 px by default.
 914        :param showControlsOnChart: enable controls block in legend to hide/show some elements on chart, `True` by default.
 915        :param showStatOnChart: show statistics block on chart, `True` (by default) mean that will be calculating additional
 916                                series, like as Trend and Average Points. And some classical indicators, like as SMA, HMA,
 917                                VWMA, Bollinger Bands, Parabolic Stop and Reverse, Alligator and Zig-Zag indicator.
 918                                Warning! Calculate statistic takes more time. If you want to decrease chart rendering time,
 919                                then set this parameter to `False`.
 920        :param inline: if `True`, then output chart in Jupyter Notebook cell. `False` by default.
 921        :return: bokeh.layouts.gridplot with all layouts objects or None.
 922        """
 923        if self.prices is None or self.prices.empty:
 924            raise Exception("Empty price data! Generate or load prices before show as Bokeh chart!")
 925
 926        else:
 927            uLogger.info("Rendering Pandas DataFrame as Bokeh chart...")
 928
 929            self.DetectTimeframe()  # auto-detect time delta between last two neighbour candles
 930            infoBlock = self.GetStatistics() if showStatOnChart else []  # calculating some indicators
 931
 932            title = self._chartTitle if title is None or not title else title  # chart title
 933            width = 1200 if width is None or width <= 0 else width  # chart summary width
 934            height = 800 if height is None or height <= 0 else height - 90  # chart summary height
 935
 936            uLogger.debug("Preparing Bokeh chart configuration...")
 937            uLogger.debug("Title: {}".format(title))
 938
 939            if inline:
 940                output_notebook(resources=INLINE, verbose=False, hide_banner=True)  # set output to notebook cell
 941
 942            # --- Preparing Main chart:
 943            chart = figure(
 944                title=title,
 945                x_axis_type="datetime",
 946                x_axis_label="Date and time",
 947                y_axis_label="Price",
 948                outline_line_width=3,
 949                outline_line_color="black" if darkTheme else "white",

 951                toolbar_location="above",

 953                min_width=width,

 958                min_border_right=0,
 959                min_border_top=0,
 960                min_border_bottom=0,
 961                y_range=Range1d(min(self.prices.low) - 3, max(self.prices.high) + 3),
 962            )
 963            chart.toolbar.logo = None  # remove bokeh logo and link to https://bokeh.org/
 964            chart.xaxis.major_label_orientation = pi / 6

 966            chart.grid.grid_line_alpha = 0.4

 970            chart.xgrid.minor_grid_line_alpha = 0.3
 971            chart.xgrid.minor_grid_line_color = "white" if darkTheme else "gray"
 972            chart.ygrid.minor_grid_line_dash = [6, 4]
 973            chart.ygrid.minor_grid_line_alpha = 0.3
 974            chart.ygrid.minor_grid_line_color = "white" if darkTheme else "gray"
 975
 976            if showStatOnChart:
 977                summaryItems = [(info, []) for info in infoBlock]
 978                if showControlsOnChart:
 979                    summaryItems += [("", []), ("Click to show/hide on chart:", [])]
 980
 981            else:
 982                summaryItems = [("Click to show/hide on chart:", [])] if showControlsOnChart else [("", [])]
 983
 984            summaryInfo = Legend(
 985                click_policy="hide",
 986                items=summaryItems,
 987                location="top_right",
 988                label_text_font_size="8pt",
 989                margin=3,
 990                padding=2,
 991                spacing=-5,
 992                label_text_font="Lucida Console",
 993            )
 994            chart.add_layout(summaryInfo, "right")
 995
 996            # preparing data for candles:
 997            inc = self.prices.open <= self.prices.close
 998            dec = self.prices.open > self.prices.close
 999            candleWidth = 108000  # as for 5 minutes by default
1000
1001            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(days=31):
1002                candleWidth = 864000000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 25 * 800  # for 43200 minutes
1003
1004            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(days=7):
1005                candleWidth = 216000000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 25 * 200  # for 10080 minutes
1006
1007            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(days=1):
1008                candleWidth = 32400000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 25 * 30  # for 1440 minutes
1009
1010            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(hours=4):
1011                candleWidth = 6480000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 25 * 6  # for 240 minutes
1012
1013            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(hours=1):
1014                candleWidth = 1620000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 25 * 1.5  # for 60 minutes
1015
1016            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(minutes=30):
1017                candleWidth = 648000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 15  # for 30 minutes
1018
1019            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(minutes=15):
1020                candleWidth = 345600  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 8  # for 15 minutes
1021
1022            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(minutes=5):
1023                candleWidth = 108000  # 12 * 60 * 60 * 2.5  # for 5 minutes
1024
1025            if self.timeframe <= timedelta(minutes=1):
1026                candleWidth = 21600  # 12 * 60 * 30   # for 1 minute
1027
1028            disabledObjects = []  # bokeh objects to hide by default when page is loaded
1029
1030            # preparing data for hover tooltips:
1031            source = {
1032                "candle": [x + 1 for x in range(-len(self.prices.close), 0, 1)],
1033                "datetime": self.prices.datetime,
1034                "open": self.prices.open,
1035                "high": self.prices.high,
1036                "low": self.prices.low,
1037                "close": self.prices.close,
1038                "volume": self.prices.volume,
1039            }
1040            hoverData = ColumnDataSource(data=source)
1041            hover = chart.select(dict(type=HoverTool))
1042            hover.name = "candle"
1043            hover.tooltips = [
1044                ("Candle", "@candle"),
1045                ("Date", "@datetime{%Y-%m-%d}"),
1046                ("Time", "@datetime{%H:%M:%S}"),
1047                ("Open", "@open{0.0000}"),
1048                ("High", "@high{0.0000}"),
1049                ("Low", "@low{0.0000}"),
1050                ("Close", "@close{0.0000}"),
1051                ("Volume", "@volume"),
1052            ]

1054                "@datetime": "datetime",
1055                "@open": "numeral",
1056                "@high": "numeral",
1057                "@low": "numeral",
1058                "@close": "numeral",
1059            }

1061            hover.line_policy = "nearest"
1062            hover.mode = "vline"

1068                line_alpha=1, name="candle", source=hoverData,
1069            )
1070            hover.renderers = [hoverOnCandles]  # hover on only for candle bodies
1071            chart.vbar(
1072                x=self.prices.datetime[inc], width=candleWidth, bottom=self.prices.open[inc], top=self.prices.close[inc],
1073                fill_color="black" if darkTheme else "white", line_color="#20ff00" if darkTheme else "black",
1074                line_width=1, fill_alpha=1, line_alpha=1,
1075            )
1076            chart.vbar(
1077                x=self.prices.datetime[dec], width=candleWidth, bottom=self.prices.open[dec], top=self.prices.close[dec],
1078                fill_color="white" if darkTheme else "#999999", line_color="#20ff00" if darkTheme else "black",
1079                line_width=1, fill_alpha=1, line_alpha=1,
1080            )
1081
1082            if showStatOnChart:
1083                # Summary section and controls:
1084                legendNameMain = "Max close / Min close / Trend line"
1085                legendNameAvg = "Averages points (highs - deltas/2)"
1086                legendNameSMA = "Simple Moving Averages (SMA: 5, 20)"
1087                legendNameSMAlong = "Long Simple Moving Averages (SMA: 50, 200)"
1088                legendNameHMA = "Hull Moving Averages (HMA: 5, 20)"
1089                legendNameVWMA = "Volume Weighted Moving Averages (VWMA: 5, 20)"
1090                legendNameBBANDS = "Bollinger Bands (BBands)"
1091                legendNamePsar = "Parabolic Stop and Reverse (psar)"
1092                legendNameAlligator = "Alligator (based on HMA: 13, 8, 5)"
1093                legendNameZigZag = "Zig-Zag indicator (with {}% of difference)".format(self.zigZagDeviation * 100)
1094
1095                # preparing for highest close line:
1096                highestClose = round(max(self.prices.close.values), self._precision)
1097                chart.line(
1098                    self.prices.datetime, highestClose,
1099                    line_width=2, line_color="yellow" if darkTheme else "#339933", line_alpha=1,
1100                    legend_label=legendNameMain if showControlsOnChart else "",
1101                )
1102                chart.text(
1103                    self.prices.datetime.values[-1], highestClose + 1 / self._deg10prec,
1104                    text=[str(highestClose)], angle=0, text_color="yellow" if darkTheme else "#339933", text_font_size="9pt",
1105                    legend_label=legendNameMain if showControlsOnChart else "",
1106                )
1107
1108                # preparing for lowest close line:
1109                lowestClose = round(min(self.prices.close.values), self._precision)
1110                chart.line(
1111                    self.prices.datetime, lowestClose,
1112                    line_width=2, line_color="yellow" if darkTheme else "#339933", line_alpha=1,
1113                    legend_label=legendNameMain if showControlsOnChart else "",
1114                )
1115                chart.text(
1116                    self.prices.datetime.values[-1], lowestClose - 2 / self._deg10prec,
1117                    text=[str(lowestClose)], angle=0, text_color="yellow" if darkTheme else "#339933", text_font_size="9pt",
1118                    legend_label=legendNameMain if showControlsOnChart else "",
1119                )
1120
1121                # preparing direction lines for all trends:
1122                if self.trendSplit is not None and self.trendSplit and self.splitCount is not None and self.splitCount:
1123                    left = 0
1124                    for trendNum in range(len(self.splitCount)):
1125                        right = left + self.splitCount[trendNum] - 1
1126                        chart.line(
1127                            [self.prices.datetime.values[left], self.prices.datetime.values[right]],
1128                            [self.prices.close.values[left], self.prices.close.values[right]],
1129                            line_width=1, line_color="white" if darkTheme else "#666666", line_alpha=0.9, line_dash=[3, 3],
1130                            legend_label=legendNameMain if showControlsOnChart else "",
1131                        )
1132                        left += self.splitCount[trendNum]
1133
1134                # preparing for main direction line:
1135                chart.line(
1136                    [self.prices.datetime.values[0], self.prices.datetime.values[-1]],
1137                    [self.prices.close.values[0], self.prices.close.values[-1]],
1138                    line_width=1, line_color="white" if darkTheme else "#666666", line_alpha=1, line_dash=[6, 6],

1140                )

1146                    legend_label=legendNameAvg if showControlsOnChart else "",
1147                ))
1148                disabledObjects.append(chart.line(
1149                    self.prices.datetime, self.prices.avg,
1150                    line_width=1, line_color="red", line_alpha=1,
1151                    legend_label=legendNameAvg if showControlsOnChart else "",
1152                ))
1153

1155

1258                    item.visible = False
1259
1260            # --- Preparing custom markers:
1261
1262            if markers is not None and isinstance(markers, pd.DataFrame) and not markers.empty and len(markers.axes) >= 2 and "datetime" in markers.columns and ("markersUpper" in markers.columns or "markersCenter" in markers.columns or "markersLower" in markers.columns):
1263                if "markersUpper" in markers.columns:
1264                    chart.text(
1265                        markers.datetime.values, self.prices.high + 0.5,
1266                        text_align="center", text_baseline="bottom", text=markers.markersUpper.values,
1267                        angle=0, text_color="lime" if darkTheme else "black", text_font_size="13pt",
1268                        legend_label="Markers: upper ({})".format(len(markers.markersUpper[markers.markersUpper != ""])) if showControlsOnChart else "",
1269                    )
1270
1271                if "markersCenter" in markers.columns:
1272                    if "avg" not in self.prices.columns:
1273                        self.prices["avg"] = round((self.prices.high + self.prices.low) / 2, self._precision)
1274
1275                    chart.text(
1276                        markers.datetime.values, self.prices.avg,
1277                        text_align="center", text_baseline="middle", text=markers.markersCenter.values,
1278                        angle=0, text_color="red" if darkTheme else "black", text_font_size="13pt",
1279                        legend_label="Markers: center ({})".format(len(markers.markersCenter[markers.markersCenter != ""])) if showControlsOnChart else "",
1280                    )
1281

1283                    chart.text(
1284                        markers.datetime.values, self.prices.low - 0.5,
1285                        text_align="center", text_baseline="top", text=markers.markersLower.values,
1286                        angle=0, text_color="lime" if darkTheme else "black", text_font_size="13pt",
1287                        legend_label="Markers: lower ({})".format(len(markers.markersLower[markers.markersLower != ""])) if showControlsOnChart else "",
1288                    )
1289
1290            else:
1291                uLogger.debug("Marker data must be the Pandas DataFrame object! Or `None` (by default). Marker is a custom symbol, example: ,  or . Dataframe with markers must contain at least two columns. There are `datetime` with date and time and some markers columns (`markersUpper`, `markersCenter` or `markersLower`). Length of markers series must be equal to the length of main candles series.")
1292
1293            if not (showControlsOnChart or showStatOnChart):
1294                summaryInfo.visible = False
1295
1296            # --- Preparing custom lines:
1297
1298            if lines is not None and isinstance(lines, list) and lines:
1299                for line in lines:
1300                    if isinstance(line, pd.DataFrame) and len(line.axes) >= 2 and "datetime" in line.columns:
1301                        chart.line(
1302                            line.datetime, line[line.columns[1]],
1303                            line_width=3, line_color="red" if darkTheme else "#666666", line_alpha=1,
1304                            legend_label="Line: " + line.columns[1] if showControlsOnChart else "",
1305                        )
1306
1307                    else:
1308                        uLogger.debug("Every custom line must be the Pandas DataFrame object! Line data must contain at least two columns: `datetime` with date and time and 2-nd column `custom_line_name` with y-coordinates. Length of the chart-line dataframes must be equal to the length of main candle series.")
1309
1310            # --- Volume chart options:
1311            volumeChart = figure(
1312                x_axis_type="datetime",

1314                outline_line_width=3,

1318                sizing_mode="scale_width",

1325                min_border_top=0,

1328                y_range=Range1d(0, max(self.prices.volume), bounds=(0, max(self.prices.volume))),
1329            )
1330            volumeChart.toolbar.logo = None  # remove bokeh logo and link to https://bokeh.org/
1331            volumeChart.xaxis.major_label_orientation = pi / 6
1332            volumeChart.xaxis.visible = False
1333            volumeChart.yaxis.formatter = NumeralTickFormatter(format="0a")
1334            volumeChart.grid.grid_line_dash = [6, 4]
1335            volumeChart.grid.grid_line_alpha = 0.5
1336            volumeChart.grid.minor_grid_line_dash = [6, 4]
1337            volumeChart.grid.minor_grid_line_alpha = 0.5
1338            volumeChart.xgrid.minor_grid_line_dash = [6, 4]

1371            volumeChart.vbar(

1374                line_width=1, fill_alpha=1, line_alpha=1,
1375            )
1376            volumeChart.vbar(
1377                x=self.prices.datetime[dec], width=candleWidth, bottom=0, top=self.prices.volume[dec],

1398                        output_file(fileName, title=title, mode="cdn")
1399                        save(unionChart, fileName)
1400
1401                    except Exception as e:
1402                        uLogger.warning("Can't render HTML! Error message: {}".format(e))
1403
1404                    else:
1405                        uLogger.info("Pandas DataFrame saved as HTML-file [{}]".format(os.path.abspath(fileName)))
1406
1407                    if showStatOnChart:
1408                        mdFile = "{}.md".format(fileName)
1409                        with open(mdFile, "w", encoding="UTF-8") as fH:
1410                            fH.write("\n".join(infoBlock))
1411
1412                            uLogger.info("Statistics saved to [{}]".format(os.path.abspath(mdFile)))
1413
1414                    if viewInBrowser:
1415                        os.system(os.path.abspath(fileName))  # view forecast chart in default browser immediately
1416
1417            return unionChart
1418
1419    def RenderGoogle(self, fileName: str = "index.html", viewInBrowser: bool = False, title: Optional[str] = None) -> None:
1420        """
1421        Rendering prices from Pandas DataFrame as non-interactive Google Candlestick chart and save it to HTML-file.
1422
1423        See also: https://developers.google.com/chart/interactive/docs/gallery/candlestickchart
1424
1425        :param fileName: HTML-file path to save Google Candlestick chart.
1426        :param viewInBrowser: If `True`, then immediately opens html in browser after rendering.
1427        :param title: specific chart title. If `None`, then used auto-generated title. `None` by default.
1428        """
1429        if self.prices is None or self.prices.empty:
1430            raise Exception("Empty price data! Generate or load prices before show as Google Candlestick chart!")
1431
1432        else:
1433            uLogger.info("Rendering Pandas DataFrame as Google Candlestick chart...")
1434
1435            self.DetectTimeframe()  # auto-detect time delta between last two neighbour candles
1436            infoBlock = self.GetStatistics()  # calculating some indicators
1437
1438            title = self._chartTitle if title is None or not title else title  # chart title
1439
1440            if self.j2model is None or not self.j2model:
1441                uLogger.debug("Preparing Google Candlestick chart configuration...")
1442                self.j2model = {"info": infoBlock, "title": title}
1443                googleDates = [pd.to_datetime(date).strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S") for date in self.prices.datetime.values]
1444                data = zip(googleDates, self.prices.low, self.prices.open, self.prices.close, self.prices.high)
1445                self.j2model["candlesData"] = [list(x) for x in data]
1446
1447            else:
1448                uLogger.debug("Using custom chart model")
1449
1450            # --- Rendering and saving chart as HTML-file and markdown-file with statistics:
1451            if os.path.exists(self.j2template):
1452                renderedTemplate = jinja2.Template(open(self.j2template, "r", encoding="UTF-8").read())
1453
1454            else:
1455                renderedTemplate = jinja2.Template(self.j2template)
1456
1457            htmlMain = renderedTemplate.render(self.j2model)
1458
1459            with open(fileName, "w", encoding="UTF-8") as fH:
1460                fH.write(htmlMain)
1461            with open("{}.md".format(fileName), "w", encoding="UTF-8") as fH:
1462                fH.write("\n".join(infoBlock))
1463
1464            if viewInBrowser:
1465                os.system(os.path.abspath(fileName))  # view forecast chart in default browser immediately
1466
1467            uLogger.info("Pandas DataFrame rendered as HTML-file [{}]".format(os.path.abspath(fileName)))

This class implements methods to generation of prices statistically similar to real ones.

Model generated: OHLCV-candlesticks (open, high, low, close, volume).

@staticmethod
def FormattedDelta(tDelta: datetime.timedelta, fmt: str) -> str: 
420    @staticmethod
421    def FormattedDelta(tDelta: timedelta, fmt: str) -> str:
422        """
423        Pretty format for timedelta objects.
424
425        Example: `FormattedDelta(timedelta(days=2, hours=3, minutes=15, seconds=35), "{days} days {hours}:{minutes}:{seconds}") -> "2 days 3:15:35"`.
426
427        :return: timedelta object formatted as a string.
428        """
429        d = {"days": tDelta.days}
430        d["hours"], rem = divmod(tDelta.seconds, 3600)
431        d["minutes"], d["seconds"] = divmod(rem, 60)
432
433        return fmt.format(**d)

Pretty format for timedelta objects.

Example: FormattedDelta(timedelta(days=2, hours=3, minutes=15, seconds=35), "{days} days {hours}:{minutes}:{seconds}") -> "2 days 3:15:35".

Returns

timedelta object formatted as a string.

def DetectPrecision( self, examples: Union[numpy.ndarray, pandas.core.series.Series, list]) -> int: 
435    def DetectPrecision(self, examples: Union[np.ndarray, pd.Series, list]) -> int:
436        """
437        Auto-detect precision from example values. E.g. `0.123 -> 3`, `0.12345 -> 5` and so on.
438        This method change `precision` variable after detect precision.
439
440        See also about statistics.mode: https://docs.python.org/3.9/library/statistics.html#statistics.mode
441        Changed in Python version >= 3.8: Now mode() method handles multimodal datasets by returning the first mode encountered.
442        Previously, it raised StatisticsError when more than one mode was found.
443
444        :param examples: chain with examples of float values.
445        """
446        uLogger.debug("Detecting precision of data values...")
447        precision = 0
448        try:
449            precision = mode(list(map(lambda x: len(str(x).split('.')[-1]) if len(str(x).split('.')) > 1 else 0, examples))) if self.precision >= 0 else 0
450
451        except StatisticsError as e:
452            uLogger.debug("Statistic mode() method return an error! Precision is set to 2 (default). StatisticsError: '{}'".format(e))
453            precision = 2
454
455        finally:
456            uLogger.debug("Auto-detected precision: {}".format(precision))
457
458        self.precision = precision
459
460        return precision

Auto-detect precision from example values. E.g. 0.123 -> 3, 0.12345 -> 5 and so on. This method change precision variable after detect precision.

See also about statistics.mode: https://docs.python.org/3.9/library/statistics.html#statistics.mode Changed in Python version >= 3.8: Now mode() method handles multimodal datasets by returning the first mode encountered. Previously, it raised StatisticsError when more than one mode was found.

Parameters
  • examples: chain with examples of float values.
def DetectTimeframe(self) -> datetime.timedelta: 
462    def DetectTimeframe(self) -> timedelta:
463        """
464        Auto-detect time delta between last two neighbour candles.
465
466        :return: timedelta object, also saved to `timeframe`.
467        """
468        self.timeframe = min(
469            self.prices.iloc[-1].datetime - self.prices.iloc[-2].datetime,
470            self.prices.iloc[-2].datetime - self.prices.iloc[-3].datetime
471        )
472        uLogger.debug("Auto-detected timeframe: {}".format(self.timeframe))
473
474        return self.timeframe

def LoadFromFile(self, fileName: str) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
476    def LoadFromFile(self, fileName: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
477        """
478        Create Pandas OHLCV-model from CSV-file.
479        Default columns in CSV-file are `["date", "time", "open", "high", "low", "close", "volume"]`.
480
481        :param fileName: path to CSV-file with OHLCV columns.
482        :return: Pandas DataFrame.
483        """
484        uLogger.info("Loading, parse and preparing input data from [{}]...".format(os.path.abspath(fileName)))
485
486        self.prices = pd.read_csv(fileName, names=self.csvHeaders, engine="python", sep=self.sep, parse_dates={"datetime": ["date", "time"]})
487        if self.horizon is None or self.horizon < 1 or self.horizon > len(self.prices):
488            self.horizon = len(self.prices)  # use loaded file "as is" with all candles
489
490        else:
491            self.prices = self.prices.tail(self.horizon)  # remove old candles, leave only the "tail" ...
492            self.prices.index = range(self.horizon)  # ... and reindex
493
494        self.ticker = os.path.basename(fileName)
495
496        self.DetectTimeframe()  # auto-detect time delta between last two neighbour candles
497
498        uLogger.info("It was read {} rows".format(self.horizon))
499        uLogger.info("Showing last 5 rows as Pandas DataFrame:")
500        for line in pd.DataFrame.to_string(self.prices[self.dfHeaders][-5:], max_cols=20).split("\n"):
501            uLogger.info(line)
502
503        return self.prices

def SaveToFile(self, fileName: str) -> None: 
505    def SaveToFile(self, fileName: str) -> None:
506        """
507        Save Pandas OHLCV model to CSV-file.
508
509        :param fileName: path to CSV-file.
510        """
511        if self.prices is not None and not self.prices.empty:
512            uLogger.info("Saving [{}] rows of Pandas DataFrame with columns: {}...".format(len(self.prices), self.csvHeaders))
513            uLogger.debug("Delimeter: {}".format(self.sep))
514            dataReplacedDateTime = self.prices.copy(deep=True)
515            dataReplacedDateTime["date"] = [d.date() for d in dataReplacedDateTime["datetime"]]
516            dataReplacedDateTime["time"] = [d.time() for d in dataReplacedDateTime["datetime"]]
517            del dataReplacedDateTime["datetime"]
518            dataReplacedDateTime = dataReplacedDateTime[self.csvHeaders]
519            dataReplacedDateTime.to_csv(fileName, sep=self.sep, index=False, header=False)
520            uLogger.info("Pandas DataFrame saved to .CSV-file [{}]".format(os.path.abspath(fileName)))
521
522        else:
523            raise Exception("Empty price data! Generate or load prices before saving!")

@staticmethod
def GetTrend( firstClose: float, lastClose: float, trendDeviation: float = 0.005) -> str: 
525    @staticmethod
526    def GetTrend(firstClose: float, lastClose: float, trendDeviation: float = 0.005) -> str:
527        """
528        Get string with trend: `"UP trend"`, `"DOWN trend"` or `"NO trend"`.
529
530        :param firstClose: close of first candle.
531        :param lastClose: close of last candle.
532        :param trendDeviation: relative deviation for trend detection, 0.005 mean 0.5% by default.
533        :return: string with trend direction `"NO trend"`, `"UP trend"` or `"DOWN trend"`.
534        """
535        if abs(firstClose - lastClose) / firstClose <= trendDeviation:
536            trend = "NO trend"
537
538        else:
539            trend = "UP trend" if firstClose <= lastClose else "DOWN trend"
540
541        return trend

Get string with trend: "UP trend", "DOWN trend" or "NO trend".

  • firstClose: close of first candle.
  • lastClose: close of last candle.
  • trendDeviation: relative deviation for trend detection, 0.005 mean 0.5% by default.
